sequence: The Volstead Act was repealed on this date in 1933, returning control of alcohol to the states, and it was a happy day at the F.X. Matt Brewery. UTICA, N.Y. -- A total of 85 years ago Wednesday marked the end of prohibition, which meant legally drinking beer again. And for the Matt family from Utica – that meant getting back to selling beer again. They let customers and suppliers know that at midnight, they could deliver, buy, and drink beer at the brewery once again. The local business managed to survive 13 years.

Technology ’ s continuing onslaught , and employees ’ responses to it , will be central issues for the American workforce in the decades ahead. There is a tendency to think of the Internet of Things , AI , cloud computing , big data analytics , and mobile devices as a kind of new generation of computer-based innovation. That would be an error. We are at the start of a shift in the nature and structure of the workplace and, by extension, of work itself. These developments, however, will transform work in the same way the industrial revolution transformed life and society in the nineteenth and twentieth centuries.

In part two of her revealing new ET interview , Paula Deen opens up to Nancy O'Dell about overcoming the most challenging times of her life to date. Deen says that when she and her husband, Michael Groover, were told their son Bobby, now 28, was HIV positive in the 90s, it was the scariest thing that had ever happened to her. "I remember, when we first got the call from his doctors that he had AIDS. That was the scariest day of my life," Deen, 66, said.

Against the odds , Auburn Smith , 16 , has become a nationally ranked wheelchair tennis player . She will compete in the World Team Cup competition in South Africa in April . The team is hoping to finish in the top ten . The competition runs from the 5th - 11th April . Auburn's mum , Lisa , said the news was unexpected but she was pleased Auburn was getting the chance . "We're all quite shocked , she's just been enjoying wheelchair tennis for a year now ," Ms Smith said . "She plays with the juniors on Wednesdays and has really been enjoying it .

WASHINGTON – Congress is moving to put under military control all armed contractors operating in combat zones , a Pentagon proposal that could affect as many as 325,000 mercenaries who provide services ranging from security to military construction. Pentagon officials have estimated that the armed private security forces, which include former military personnel, now make up nearly 40 percent of the U.S. military in Afghanistan. The new Pentagon proposal, which is expected to be signed by Defense Secretary Robert Gates soon, would require mercenaries to operate under the same rules as the military, said a Defense official with knowledge of the plan.

JERUSALEM — The face-off at the security gate outside the Western Wall one Friday this month was familiar : for the first time, women were about to be permitted to enter a space where they are currently barred. Hundreds of women and a few men stood patiently in line at the traditional women's plaza — the only area in which they can access the site — waiting to cross a security barrier into the area of the Western Wall known as "the Kotel ha-Maharsha," or the men's section, which is separated by the barrier.

Born June 9th , 1951 , Willem `` Wim '' Smith passed on August 2nd , 2017 . Wim was born in New York city, New York , to William and Gertrude Smith , he was the oldest of 3 boys , and the first of his family to pass. Wim was a graduate of the Bronx high School of Science and went on to get his B.S in Biochemistry from Brooklyn College . He then continued his graduate studies in Chemistry at Columbia University , where he met his wife of 36 years , the late Sharon Smith , who was also a doctoral candidate at the time .

Over the next few months, many federal employees will receive performance ratings. Some may believe their ratings to be unreasonably low. What can be done? There is a review process for most employees, but that process generally functions within the agency’s control (with exceptions for bargaining unit employees and successful equal employment opportunity complainants) and is often criticized as being unfriendly to complaining employees. Nonetheless, an appeal might be successful if an employee is careful, thorough and able to strike the right notes. Appeals take numerous forms. Following is a summary of different groups of employees and how the processes may differ.

Have you heard the latest uproar? Of course you haven't - it's too loud. So say some residents who frequent downtown. Others say the bluster is louder than any motorcycle exhaust pipe. We say everyone should turn down the volume on complaining and let people go about their own business downtown. Also, let the police do their job. There is already a downtown noise ordinance in place, and the police reported to the city Tuesday that new measures are coming. First, the bikers.

Best Buy Co. Inc. shares surged 9% in premarket trade after the electronics retailer's fiscal third-quarter profit and revenue sailed past estimates. Best Buy said it had net income of $107 million, or 30 cents a share, in the quarter, up from $54 million, or 12 cents a share, in the year-earlier period. Adjusted per-share earnings came to 32 cents, well ahead of the 25 cents estimate from analysts polled by FactSet. Revenue rose to $9.38 billion from $9.33 billion, also ahead of the FactSet estimate of $9.11 billion.

SOMERSET - The Golden Eagles wrestling team gave the Somerset senior night fans a lot to cheer about as the Eagles overpowered visiting Conemaugh Township 57-12 on Thursday. The Indians were able to win only four bouts, one by a pin at 112 by Matt Ofansko, while the Eagles piled up a total of six pins, two forfeit wins and two wins by decisions. Conemaugh Township fans even saw their top wrestler, Robert Horner go down to defeat for the first time this season. Horner lost a hard fought 2-1 decision to Somerset's Josh Mosgrave. The defeat was Horner's first in 15 matches.

The police have uncovered Class A drugs after using its powers of stop-and-search in Central Park . Arrests were made and searches conducted by officers in the town centre on Saturday evening and Sunday morning, following a series of concerns raised by the public in the area. Police have not revealed which drugs had been found, with the force's spokeswoman saying: "I don't think you'd be surprised that we would not go into detail about our methods." The stop and search operation in Newcastle town centre was launched following complaints that people were being threatened and robbed in the area.

Plushenko’s glorious career was finished. He had hoped to cap it at home after a comeback from spinal surgery, which he did, partially, by helping Russia win the team competition. But his 31-year-old back, after all those years of wrenching revolutions and hard landings, gave out two nights too soon. In essence, Plushenko sacrificed his chance at another individual medal to put his country on top. He was a longshot for gold, but in a sport of sequins and stuffed animals, he brought pugnacious sizzle. He was the James Cagney of the ice.

Salads from McDonald 's have been linked to more than 500 cases of an intestinal illness in the US . They've now been linked to E Coli O157 H7 bacteria. The bacteria can be harmful, but it does not cause death. 57 people from 15 states have been infected with the bacteria, but none of the cases have been reported in Canada at this point in time. McDonald’s spokesperson says that the salads are supplied to them by an outside party, and that the company and its supplier are investigating the problem and taking all the appropriate steps to ensure that the customers are protected.

The feud between California and the Trump administration grows as the president visits the California-Mexico border to inspect wall prototypes that will never be built. By the time Donald Trump visited the U.S. border with Mexico for the first time on Monday, he'd had the idea to build a wall between the two nations for months. His administration spent a week designating the border a national emergency. And he signed an executive order — on the ground in California — authorizing the construction of "at least" 33-feet-high walls along the border. Trump went to San Diego on Monday to inspect eight different "prototypes."

Certainly one of the most brilliant dialogues in the ballet is its pas de deux . It was danced excellently here, with a real sense of the dueling, competitive attraction between the male and female principals. (The dancers for the two lead roles are often double-casted.) For the entire first act the stage was set for a love-triangle, with the leading ballerina, Zhao Yi Ling, dancing the role of Kitri. But a little over an hour later, in the last scene of act one, she was changed into a man and danced as Basilio by one of the men, Hailong Dong.

The Dallas-Fort Worth Film Critics Association, of which this reporter is a member, has named Moonlight as the best film of 2016, as part of the results of its 23rd annual critics’ poll. The intimate drama that follows a boy living in inner city Miami through three stages of his young life was also given three other awards: best director for Barry Jenkins, best supporting actor for Mahershala Ali, and the the Russell Smith Award, an honor given annually to the best low-budget or cutting-edge independent film. The award is named for the late Dallas Morning News film critic.

The pheasant-hunting season in New York is under way, and thanks to a great stocking program hunters should find plenty of action. New York’s DEC says it has released close to 25,000 adult pheasants on lands open to public hunting. The pheasant season began Oct. 1 in northern and eastern portions of the state, and will open on Saturday in central and western parts and Nov. 1 on Long Island. Pheasants are raised at the DEC’s Reynolds Game Farm in Ithaca. The majority of the birds will be released on state wildlife-management areas and cooperative hunting areas prior to and during the fall hunting season.

Cryptocurrencies , outside of Bitcoin , have failed to garner much attention from buyers , and while the same can be said for most altcoin investments, one project has caught the interest of a few investors and analysts. In a note published on December 21 , analysts at FxPro said the Bitcoin ETF is not a bad idea, but it would be hard for it to gain traction. Bitcoin is still the most widely-known digital currency in the world , and it is still the most popular investment option for investors to gain exposure to the crypto market.

The Geo Quiz has an American culinary twist this time. The city we want you to name was named after a French city, located on the banks of the Loire River. Its American counterpart is on the Mississippi. There's a lot of French and Cajun influence there. You can see it in the city's architecture, and taste it in its distinctive cuisine. But the food in this city is more than just crawfish etoufee' and beignets. Spanish, Italian, Native American and African culinary traditions are also part of the stew in this melting pot of flavors.

Johnson prepares to leave key K-12 post at Education Dept . Henry L. Johnson , a major addition to the education team in the Clinton administration, will announce Monday the end of a nearly two-year stint at the helm of the Department of Education's policy-making office for elementary and secondary schools. Johnson, whose resignation goes into effect June 30, played a central role in shaping President Clinton's education policy proposals. Mr. Johnson also led a broad-based review of the federal education laws, including the 4-year-old law that mandates equitable access to public school education.

A BARGAIN pair of activewear leggings are set to sell out within days , with fans saying they give dearer brands such as Reebok, Nike and Adidas a run for their money. A BARGAIN pair of leggings are so sought after that they are on track to sell out within days , with fans saying they are just as good as expensive brands Nike, Adidas and Lululemon. A bargain pair of black workout leggings from Primark are on track to sell out after fans of the low-cost high street brand said the leggings were "better" than brands such as Reebok, Lululemon and Adidas.

We chose to question the narrative of history by simply quoting words which Churchill used himself. At a glance, Blighty Café appears to be another one of those trendy and sophisticated coffee shops that offer the terribly appealing combination of tasteful beverages, off-beat music and the inviting aroma of freshly-baked sourdough bread. As a university student living in the area, of course, I couldn’t resist. Sounds perfect, right? Except, sitting in the mock air-raid shelter, drinking my flat white, I couldn’t help but feel ever more uncomfortable.

North Korean hacking group focuses attacks on aging and soon-to-be-deprecated technology. Five-Star hackers: High-end hotel data thieves return to target government officials The DarkHotel hacking group has returned -- but this time they're focusing on a different target, using a new strain of Inexsmar malware. Internet Explorer's scripting engine was the favorite target of a North Korean cyber-espionage group this year, after the hackers deployed two zero-days, but also crafted new exploits for two other older vulnerabilities. The group's name is DarkHotel, a cyber-espionage group that McAfee and many other cyber-security firms have already linked to the Pyongyang regime.

Following a team of international scientists , this film exclusively documents an archeological sensation : the exploration of royal tombs in Amara West, the ancient capital of Kush in present Sudan. For centuries, the ruins of the city of Amara remained hidden in sand dunes. An expedition from the University of Pennsylvania in Philadelphia recently uncovered the first of these tombs. The tombs are lavishly decorated, the finds are unprecedented and include gold jewellery and bronze statues. The discoveries raise hopes of exciting new insights into the rise of the first African empire and into the history of the African civilisations from antiquity.

It's hard to imagine that 2001: A Space Odyssey would have its incredible cinematic impact without that classical soundtrack. But director Stanley Kubrick originally hired a composer to score the film, only to abandon the score in postproduction. Kubrick tapped Alex North, who had scored a number of classic films, including Kubrick's own Spartacus, to write the 2001 score. Kubrick deemed the score inadequate for the film, and replaced it with the classical musical tracks that are so familiar today. North wasn't aware of the change until the film premiered.

A Houston district court judge who lost a re-election bid on Tuesday is facing criticism for releasing a majority of the juvenile defendants who appeared before him Wednesday after allegedly asking them whether they planned to kill anyone. District Court Judge Glenn Devlin, a Republican, lost his seat Tuesday to Democratic opponent Natalia Oakes — in a wave of 59 conservative jurists who had been ousted by Harris County voters, NBC Houston affiliate KPRC reported. And on Wednesday morning, Devlin had made a decision that shocked Steve Halpert, juvenile division chief for Harris County's Public Defender's Office.

ANTIOCH 6/5/16 – When Trevor Dunning first entered the Trinity Christian School speech class , he was personally greeted , and as he was leaving , he was asked to say good-bye and he told his teacher that she could call him “T”. But that’s when she stopped him and said , “Trevor , is it ok if we call you Trev?” She was told by a student , that it was the only boy she had known who would let a girl call him by a girl’s name.

Ellen Lucas has been running the Carson Nugget Nevada Day Classic for longer than she cares to remember. The Gardnerville runner decided to try something different Saturday and wound up with a new course record. Lucas, 47, finished as the first woman overall in the Carson City 8-kilometer race and set a course masters women’s record with a time of 32 minutes, 47 seconds. Her time broke the old course standard of 33:19 set by Jackie Taylor in 1999. Brett Long was the overall winner in a men’s course record of 26:35 and Gregorio Castro edged defending race champion and training partner Agustin Arroy for second-place.

It was a bountiful year for books in English by Quebec writers . Ian McGillis looks back at some of the best
MONTREAL — In the 19th century, the French-language novel was the mainstay of Quebec publishing. In the 20th century, poetry took over. In the early 21st, a new medium has emerged as Quebec’s most vibrant literary arena: the bilingual novel. The best of this new genre are a reminder that we’re in the midst of a renaissance not only in Quebec’s fiction, but in the entire country.

I was delighted to read in Eureka Street Ruby Hamad’s passionate protest that she and other Muslims should not constantly be called to account for the vicious behaviour of IS. Still less to be stigmatised until unnamed Muslim leaders disowned it. I was disconcerted to see so many Eureka Street readers appeared to agree with the demands against which she protested. Both Ruby’s complaint and the responses to it reminded me of the attitudes taken to Catholics in an earlier generation. The popular charges against Catholics were honed in the Great War and particularly by the referenda on Conscription.

Want to know why we’re in a war of information? Talk to the team that’s on the front lines of the new battles over what we know, what’s real and how we make decisions.

So when I say this, I want to make clear I am willing to work in a bipartisan way to do it," Clinton said. "It can't just be done by executive order.

Tacko Fall , who stands 7 ’ 5″ , is unstoppable . Likely the tallest player in high school basketball history , he will be a top prospect for the 2020 NBA Draft. But he is not just a player, he is a leader. A man of the people . And now he is on a mission to help his fellow Liberians in his home country . His journey to help his home is one that can inspire us all . Tacko is a big guy in more ways than one. He’s a big man on campus at UCF .

Under Trump , presidential pardons have become a way to reward blind loyalty—and to punish his predecessor . Since discovering the pardon power in 1791, every US president has wielded it to free a person from punishment. "It's a presidential power, so it's only a pardon if a president is willing to exercise it". "I'm thinking about it and I think they'd want it". "I don't want to go into it". In response, Trump said he doesn't want to talk about the pardon as his legal team is doing a lot of work in the area.

Evo Morales, Bolivia's president-elect, fresh from meetings with the leaders of Cuba and Venezuela, says that his country welcomes foreign investors, but it will not relinquish control of its natural resources. "Bolivia needs partners, foreign investors, but not owners of our natural resources," Morales told reporters on Wednesday in Madrid where he was stopping as part of a continuing tour that includes visits to France, Belgium, South Africa, China and Brazil. "My government ... is going to exercise its property right over its natural resources."

Until further guidance is issued, USCIS is temporarily applying interim procedures to H-1B non-profit entity petitions filed with the agency seeking an exemption from the statutory H-1B numerical cap based on an affiliation with or relation to an institution of higher education, an official announcement said. Effective immediately, during this interim period USCIS will give deference to prior determinations made since June 6, 2006, that a non-profit entity is related to or affiliated with an institution of higher education – absent any significant change in circumstances or clear error in the prior adjudication – and, therefore, exempt from the H-1B statutory cap.

In the age of Instagram, food is no longer designed to just be food. It’s a set piece, a lifestyle statement of fantastical hyperbole. So we drink unicorn lattes, eat rainbow bagels, and lick our charcoal-black soft serve in front of neon signs. Food is no longer about eating. It’s about the documentation of unattainable perfection, catching the next ever-illusive meme. Yet in this new wave of food-as-influencer, there is a single, curmudgeonly brand that insists on photographing its dishes on conference room tables, under fluorescent lighting, and from all sorts of unflattering angles.

The Economic Research Department of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka says that according to provisional data, the overall fiscal performance has improved during the first five months of 2016. The department says that Government revenue as a percentage of estimated GDP has increased to 5.% during the first five months of 2016. Total expenditure and net lending during the first five months of 2016 remained unchanged at 7.2% of estimated GDP compared to the same period in 2015. Consequently, the overall budget deficit declined to 2.3% of estimated GDP during the first five months of 2016 compared to 2.7% recorded in the corresponding period of 2015.

But I think that it can also be mint, it all depends on how you are looking at it. i think that the color is blue, but I can also see how the blue would be interpreted as mint green.

Best Buy Co. Inc. shares surged 9 % in premarket trade after the electronics retailer & apos ; s fiscal-year outlook beat forecasts, helped by the success of its buyback program & apos ; S and mobile phone growth, which offset weak demand for personal computers. The company now has $8.4 billion of buyback authority left for this fiscal year, & apos ; S Chief Financial Officer Jason Glass said in a conference call. Shares of Best Buy have rallied 18 % year to date through Thursday, while the SPDR Retail ETF (XRT) has fallen 14 %.

Bloxx kick off their latest jaunt across the UK with a headline gig at the Craufurd Arms on Wednesday nextweek. The rockers will be in the area to play their first gig in Banbury in a year following the success of their self-titled EP which was released in October last year. Lead singer JJ Smith said of the upcoming tour: “To be honest we’ve not done a lot of shows out of Banbury recently which is a real shame because we really do love coming to Banbury and the people here really love us.

The husband of a woman suspected of cutting a fetus out of another woman told police he found the baby on the floor of their bedroom. Jennifer Delgado, 21, was arrested on a charge of aggravated battery in the Oct. 28 attack, which happened at her mother-in-law’s Miami home. Her husband, Hector Diaz, 23, was arrested on a charge of tampering with evidence, police said. A woman is accused of cutting out a baby in Miami. “The victim in the case is the woman who was attacked,” Miami-Dade police Detective Karel Diaz, told WPLG-TV.

The proposal that foreign powers acquire land in Africa to stem migration is nothing but 'hipster' colonialism. Last week, Germany's Africa Commissioner Gunter Nooke said that European countries should be allowed to lease land and to build and run cities in Africa as a means of stemming what he views as the unchecked expansion of migration from Africa to Europe. For Nooke, allowing the "free development" of these areas would stimulate African economies and create "growth and prosperity" and therefore, reduce the attractiveness of Europe as a destination for migration. The proposal has elicited mixed reactions.

Gotham is dealing a familiar Joker in Season 2 . Seemingly confirming what the Fox drama ’ s showrunner Bruno Heller recently teased in an interview with TVLine, the first episode of Season 2 will find Jerome (Cameron Monaghan) donning the white makeup and purple suit to become the show's second Joker. It's been a long time coming for Jerome/Joker fans who have been waiting to see that transformation since the Season 1 finale, and Heller says he has big things in store for the character who will be pulling some Joker moves this time around, despite having no superhuman abilities.

I thought I was an acceptable kind of evangelical. I'm not a fundamentalist. My friends and I enjoy art, alcohol, and cultural engagement. We avoid spiritual clichés and buzzwords. We value authenticity, study, racial reconciliation, and social and environmental justice. Being a Christian made me somewhat weird in my urban, progressive context, but despite some clear differences, I held a lot in common with unbelieving friends. We could disagree about truth, spirituality, and morality, and remain on the best of terms. The failures of the church often made me more uncomfortable than those in the broader culture.

(And how much we actually grab red pens and paper calendars these days is another topic, though many of us remain devoted to the classic way of time-keeping.)

Most people have heard of Scrooge, even if they have never read A Christmas Carol or any other work of Charles Dickens, writes Adrian Hattrell. What is certain is that they have never experienced the story in the form of a folk opera, which is what was presented to Tickhill Music Society by the group calling itself Green Matthews and Guest – which comprised of Chris Green, Sophie Matthews and Jude Rees. The players set the scene with a medley of Victorian carols, music hall songs and folk songs, accompanying themselves on an astonishing range of period instruments, which were variously blown, plucked and squeezed.

Sanday , a Scottish island inhabited by only six people , has just got its first road – an unpaved track, but one which has been designed to make it easier for pedestrians to walk around, and easier for the island's only car to get from one part of the island to another. It's being funded by Scottish Natural Heritage who are paying half the cost of £10,000 – the other half is being donated by the islanders and a local group, the West Mainland Trust, who own most of the land on Sanday ( the Scottish government own the sea around it).

Sean Bean has made a career of being around royalty in epic fantasy . He was the heir to the thrones of two nations in "The Lord of the Rings" (Elijah Wood was the king of the Shire). In "Sharpe" he was an officer in the 18th-century British Army, and he served as the right hand man of the 21st-century British monarch in "The King's Man." It turns out that his latest royal role is actually based in reality. Bean is playing the part of King Richard III in an upcoming series on the History Channel.

A shopping bonanza has hit Bawadi Mall , and will continue until May 1 , as part of Retail Abu Dhabi’s (RAD) month-long Shopping Mega Sales event. Spanning across three floors at Bawadi Mall, including the food court, the sales event offers shoppers a chance to save up to 70 per cent on a huge range of fashion and lifestyle brands. From electronics and gadgets, to jewellery, perfumes and more, the mall has a wide range of discounts on offer across the month, including savings on cosmetics from leading brands, such as Max Factor.

No doubt if you are into painting of the artistic kind then you will probably know that artist Thomas Kinkade was the pioneering figure in what is now known as the “painterly photography” genre. It is the kind of painting wherein the painter would use digital images to create an illusion of a real photograph. He was known for his ability to combine artistry with the technology of digital images and this is what made Kinkade an iconic painter whose paintings are coveted even today. Kinkade was born on February 19th, 1958 in Evergreen, Colorado and was an American painter and writer.

EXCLUSIVE: Jacqueline Piñol has booked a recurring role on Amazon’s drama series Bosch. She will play Detective Julie Espinosa, a veteran in the LAPD’s robbery/homicide division, in a multi-episode arc. She is appointed by Frank Silva (Nestor Serrano) as co-lead on an investigation along with Coniff (David Marciano) to help out Deputy Chief Irving (Lance Reddick). Bosch is a police procedural based on Michael Connelly‘s novels about a veteran homicide detective with the Los Angeles Police Department. Piñol most recently guest starred on the premiere episode of the final season of Criminal Minds.

A new study for The New York Times reveals that the media pay for the top 200 CEOs is now higher than the average American's. For the first time since the 1980s, the media's highest-paid executives out-earn the average American worker, according to an analysis of the top 200 chief executives at News Corp, Disney, Time Warner, Viacom, Comcast and 187 other media companies. The average salary and bonus package for these CEOs was $23.2 million last year, compared with $22,581 for a worker making a median salary, according to the study.

There is broad agreement that moving patient records into the computer age is essential to improving care and curbing costs. MARSHFIELD, Wis. — Joseph Calderaro, 67, is one of health care’s quiet success stories. Over the last four years, he has carefully managed his diabetes by lowering his blood sugar, blood pressure and cholesterol with diet, exercise and medication. To keep on track, Mr. Calderaro visits his doctor, attends meetings for diabetes patients and gets frequent calls from a health counselor. It is a team effort, orchestrated by the Marshfield Clinic here.

Shares in Premier Foods shot up five per cent earlier today after the Mr Kipling and Hovis group said it expected to meet its full-year profit expectations. The St Albans-based group said sales at its eight power brands, including Mr Kipling, Bisto and Ambrosia, increased by 2 per cent sales in the three months to the end of September. So far this year, the group’s main grocery brands have delivered a 4.1 per cent sales increase, boosted by marketing campaigns including the launch of Mr Kipling ‘Great British Fancies’ for the Queen's Diamond Jubilee.

The movement is a global phenomenon – but here it has stalled before even getting started . RIDESHARING SERVICES WHICH PROMOTE THEIR OWN APPS ARE STILL WAITING FOR GOVERNMENT APPROVAL TO START OPERATING. This has been a problem throughout 2014. Uber has been shut down several times and was banned for good in September . Egypt is among the countries that are trying to regulate apps like Uber. It has banned Uber services because of a taxi strike, although a court then overruled the decision. The U.S. has had an Uber ban in Los Angeles, where the city regulators claim the company was operating illegally, but the service has since returned.

According to The Hollywood Reporter , multiple sources claim the president’s son is already lining up deals as he plans for the next stage of his career. He has even already begun talks with Fox News , which has long been rumored to be where the second son of the president will eventually end up. May 23 - Egyptians arrive early at voting booth to cast their vote for the first president since deposed leader Hosni Mubarak. Deborah Lutterbeck reports
People in Egypt are heading to the polls. They'll elect a president to replace the deposed Hosni Mubarak in the first election since a popular uprising swept the country. Egyptians began voting early. And many said they were doing so to avoid the crowds. (SOUNDBITE) (Arabic) EGYPTIAN VOTER WAFAH ABDO, SAYING: "I came to cast my vote in advance so that I can go to work.

A high profile heavyweight boxing match at Sands Casino Resort Bethlehem will be broadcast live on NBC Saturday as Tomasz Adamek (50-4, 28 KOs) faces off against Mike Perez (26-1, 15 KOs). Perez, a 28 year old Pole, and Adamek, a 33 year old Pole will fight in what has the makings of a classic matchup. The Adamek vs. Perez boxing match is set to take place at 9 PM ET, and will be streamed online on NBC Sports Live Extra and will be nationally telecast on NBC.

Angela Mahoney, 52, of Bentley, scooped �75,000 on the Irish Lottery and could now win another million, thanks to an appeal by The Star to find her. A dinner lady who scooped £75,000 on the Irish Lottery could now win another million, thanks to our appeal to find her. Angela Mahoney, 52, of Bentley, used numbers from her late mother’s date of birth to win £75,000 from a £1 stake on a Betfred Irish Lottery game. Betfred have issued this poster to try and locate the mystery woman before 12 noon this Saturday.

Briefly : Each time we get the chance to pass along a bit of info about Christopher Nolan ‘ s Inception , we get a little more psyched . Today , we’re getting another look at the film , as evidenced by the above . Inception , like The Dark Knight , is set for release in both IMAX theaters as well as regular old 3-D theaters this summer , with the first trailer dropping in February and the first official stills hitting last week. Now , the studio has released another look at the Nolan film , and it looks even more promising .

German scientists working on the Wendelstein 7-X fusion device started a series of experiments that could eventually prove the superiority of this kind of energy production compared to traditional sources. German scientists have started the experiments that will put the Wendelstein 7-X fusion device to test. The experiments are expected to prove the superiority of the W7-X over traditional sources of energy and open a door to a new source of power generation. The W7-X is the biggest experimental fusion reactor in the world and was constructed at the Max Planck Institute for Plasma Physics in Germany.

Clinton said this week paid family leave is possible by taxing the wealthy but states have done so without soaking the rich. In her opening statement at the first Democratic debate Tuesday, Hillary Clinton mentioned the need for paid family leave, and when asked about it later, she said it was possible to pay for it by having the wealthy foot the bill. The line may be good fodder for Democrats, but looking at how states have done it, as well as current national proposals, show other ways to pay for the policy without soaking the rich.

Salad may be an overlooked part of the holiday meal , but it doesn ’ t have to be that way. Try any of these great salad recipes on your next holiday party menu. For more holiday dinner and. These are the best healthy salad recipes, from simple side dishes to more complex salads with multiple ingredients.

Swedish furnishing giant IKEA is still looking to build a new store in Coventry which could create around 600 jobs, it has confirmed. News of the new store was welcomed by city bosses and the region’s manufacturing base. Cllr Jim O'Boyle said: “I’m very pleased about this news. "IKEA is very welcome in the West Midlands and I hope the planning will be straightforward and the store will be opened without delay. Cllr Jim O Boyle, Coventry City Council cabinet member for jobs and regeneration.

James Grady scored in the final minute of the final game to hand Gretna an amazing victory that clinched promotion and consigned Ross County to the drop. Michael Gardyne blasted County into the lead from the edge of the box. Nicky Deverdics replied four minutes later from close range and Grady broke clear to fire Gretna ahead. Deiarmuid O'Carroll bundled an equaliser, but Grady broke clear to fire Gretna ahead and deny St Johnstone promotion in a dramatic finish. By that time, County had already gone down after Airdrie beat Queen of the South. Gretna had been forced to win their final game after squandering a 12-point lead in Division One.

The GoPro brand is synonymous with the action cameras. Whether you use it daily or occasionally, many of you probably have one model or another sitting around the house. Even though GoPro’s point-and-shoot simplicity makes it easy to use, there are plenty of extra tricks you can learn to take your filmmaking to the next level. If your helmet is blocking 90 percent of your GoPro’s field of view, you’ll want to know about it as early as possible, not after you’ve been out kayaking for five hours.

After reports , speculation , and rumors – it ’ s now official . There is going to be a new X-Men film and it will take place in the 70’s. This will be the first in a new trilogy, with the next films to take place in the ’ 80s. It’s not just the films that will be rebooted. Fox is also in the midst of a big reboot of their X-Men cartoon. This is in the works from Marvel Studios, which is not only in charge of the live-action series, but has recently also been tasked with rebooting the 90s X-Men animated series .

A local nonprofit whose mission is to transform the lives of at-risk youths will host its sixth annual fiesta fundraiser from 1:30 to 4:30 p.m. April 29 at Veterans Memorial Stadium, 3001 Park Ave. E. The fiesta will offer fun, fellowship and a tasty Mexican buffet, as well as prizes. Fort Worth Hispanic Women was incorporated in 1991 and has become a leader in the Fort Worth community in helping at-risk youths. It is also the recipient of the 2015 Outstanding Small Nonprofit of the Year from the American Heart Association. The organization has developed programs for youth ages 10 to 19.

What Steve Lonegan can teach Republicans about making life hell for Democrats . New Jersey Senate candidate Steve Lonegan may lose his bid to unseat Cory Booker in November, but the conservative activist is giving his Republican colleagues around the country something to think about — namely, how to make life miserable for Democrats like the ones he faces. In his quest to oust a sitting U.S. Senator in one of the most Democratic states in the country, the Newark mayor was able to pull off a shocking upset over the establishment’s favored GOP candidate.

China began three days of national mourning for the victims of the May 12 earthquake, restricting access to entertainment content both on the Internet and broadcast media. The official English-language newspaper China Daily reported Monday that "All public amusements will be suspended for three days from Monday. The State Council, the Cabinet, on Sunday ordered a nationwide display of respect for the dead." Major portals Sina.com and Sohu.com limited their home page offerings to news content. Sohu adopted an all-black font, with most of the links on the top half of the page relating to earthquake news.

Ryanair has lowered its full year profit guidance from a current range of €1.25-€1.35 billion to a new range of €1.15-€1.20 billion. The reduction comes in the wake of two profit warnings issued by Ryanair during the summer, the first of which was the result of higher fuel prices. The airline has already cut full year capacity growth forecasts from a current range of 6-8% to a new range of 4-6%, and has warned that it will now only be able to grow full year profit by 3% rather than 10%.

The AKP should take comfort in its large majority and start to view minority views and even peaceful dissent benignly. This would be a major change in the political climate for Turkey and would go a long way to reassuring the US, the EU and the International Community that the AKP is not a totalitarian regime but a responsible political party that recognises the legitimacy of its opposition. At the end of this article you will see how far the AKP has to go before it can claim to be a genuine political party that can be relied upon in times of crisis.

The right sheet set and pajamas can help you stay cool. Today’s memory-foam mattresses don't sleep as "hot" as older models did, thanks to air-circulating layers and ventilated toppers that keep the foam from absorbing and retaining all your body heat. But a certain insulating effect is unavoidable when you're sleeping on a foam block. If your memory foam mattress leaves you sweating at night, a few remedies can help turn down the heat -- if only by a few degrees. Anything you can do to distance your body from the memory foam will help keep you cool.

While the SP-BSP-RLD alliance may disrupt the caste math in many pockets, the Congress is relegated to the role of a vote-splitter. Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s popularity is still high in western UP but will that be adequate to repeat a 2014-like sweep? As eight constituencies go to polls on Thursday, ET takes a closer look into what’s turning into a seat-to-seat battle. While the SP-BSP-RLD alliance may disrupt the caste math in many pockets, the Congress is relegated to the role of a vote-splitter. In the Bundelkand and Yadav belts, the Modi factor appears to matter more.

James Grady scored in the final minute of the final game to hand Gretna an amazing victory that clinched promotion to the Premiership for the first time in more than 20 years. A dramatic finish to the game at Forthbank saw Berwick manager Ian Little's side, who had been trailing for much of the match, snatch a 3-3 draw against Gretna in the third tier of the Scottish football league pyramid. Gretna's hopes of a win to take them back into the Scottish Premier Division after a 15-year exile were dashed when Grady headed a rebound off the post to earn Berwick a replay at Shielfield Park on Saturday, 12 December.

Sunkett said the running back positions are still up from grabs and that the ground attack will be by committee with the three running backs all getting the same number of carries. The biggest question for the Panthers is which quarterback will get the most playing time, if not the majority. Senior quarterback Collin Cox, junior Ryan Keller and a freshman will be vying for the starting position.

New Delhi : The ruling Communist Party of India ( Marxist ) , or CPM , is prepared for a "civil war" with India's Hindu nationalist Prime Minister Narendra Modi in the coming election, said senior CPM leader Bhupendra Badgujar. "We are prepared for a civil war with Modi in the upcoming general election. The people of the country are now aware of the communal Modi, who has destroyed the country's economy," Badgujar, who is also a Member of Rajya Sabha, said while addressing an election rally in Baroda on Sunday.

In recent years, platformers have proven to be a hospitable genre for video game developers looking to flaunt their artistry. For the generation of designers who grew up playing “Super Mario Bros.” platformers offer a sound formula. Though the goal of such games is usually to get from one area to the next, that framework supports copious possibilities. Determining how a character moves through a world and what sorts of things should impede or assist in the process allows plenty of room for creativity. It is why games like “Journey” and “Inside” can both be constructed around jumping avatars but otherwise appear quite distinct.

MANCHESTER UNITED outcast Morgan Schneiderlin has emerged as a January target for Inter Milan, according to reports. Schneiderlin has fallen down the pecking order at Manchester United under Jose Mourinho. Despite Bastian Schweinsteiger also being marginalised, Schneiderlin has been unable to force his way into the side over the likes of Paul Pogba, Ander Herrera, Michael Carrick and Marouane Fellaini. United are set to cut their losses on the midfielder this summer just 18 months after he signed for £24million from Southampton. And Italian website Calcio Mercato claim that Inter Milan want to bring the France international to the San Siro.

The British are known for their collective stiff upper lip . The elements of British style translate easily in every aspect of our lives, from home décor to fashion to our personalities. In the 17th century, British style was the ultimate in fashion. The English had perfected tailoring of clothes, and their tailors traveled the world creating wardrobe for royals from all over. Their clothes were the epitome of style and quality. Elegance is key to British style, no matter the setting. It is evident in how British people dress and the decor of their homes.

Former police officer Drew Peterson threw his wife to the floor one night, grabbed her throat and told her he "could kill her there and then," a one-time co-worker of the wife testified Tuesday at a hearing to determine what evidence can be admitted in Peterson's murder trial. Kathleen Savio, Drew Peterson's third wife, who mysteriously drowned in a bathtub six years ago, essentially is testifying from the grave during the hearing. Witnesses are expected to tell a judge how Savio discussed and wrote about her fears that Peterson, a former Bolingbrook police sergeant, would kill her.

He admits for the fi rst time he was surprised by how badly England performed. England have certainly made strides this season and Capello knows he goes on trial again when the team gets to Poland and Ukraine next summer.

In December 2013, INSYS received a subpoena from the Office of Inspector General (OIG) of the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), which notified the company of the commencement of an investigation by the DOJ’s Civil Division into the company’s sales and commercial practices and resulted in the company’s corresponding public disclosure. As is often the case, this four-and-a-half-year investigation has been conducted in concert with certain whistleblower litigation that was filed under seal prior to and during the course of the DOJ’s investigation.

Four detection stations throughout the Large Hadron Collider will help gather huge amounts of information about what happens during each collision, possibly revealing new information about the basic makeup of the universe. Today was perhaps the most exciting day in a more than a decade for scientists and science lovers around the world. Not since the comet Shoemaker-Levy 9 broke into fragments and collided with Jupiter in 1994 has there been as much news and excitement over a single event in the scientific community. Rather than corresponding to a massive, cosmic event, today’s news focused on the sub-atomic level.

A FAKE doctor allegedly used useless metal rods to test people for cancer and diabetes then charged a fortune to cure them. Onelio Hipolit-Gonzalez, 73, also claimed the device could diagnose multiple sclerosis and vision problems. Hipolit-Gonzalez was arrested last week in Florida for practicing the sham procedures out of his friend's home. The procedure also involved taking a patient’s blood before re-injecting it back into their bodies. Fox 13 reported Hipolit-Gonzalez posted ads online featuring a picture of him in a white lab coat with Dr. Onelio Hipolit stitched into it – although authorities say he never had a medical licence in the state.

Why do we only hear about Jasper Johns when he gets ripped off ? Jasper Johns is the greatest artist alive today and the only living artist to be mentioned in the same sentence as Paul Klee, Rene Magritte and Francis Bacon. Every time he comes up for sale, I get a little twitchy. I am not saying the paintings he is selling nowadays are great art, although I believe they are, but he is an artist and every time he shows his face I start to worry. There are a number of reasons this should make you nervous.

The five-storied 'Farhad Mansion' resembles any other well-maintained house in an affluent neighbourhood of Chittagong city. Yet no gatekeeper guards any of the two steel gates that lead to the small front yard and the stairway of the building. With the summer holidays, it is not surprising that the ground and fourth floors that house an English medium school are deserted. But even the residential second and third floors show no signs of life. Climbing to the top, the locked grilled-gate to the roof is reached. Standing there, one cannot help but shudder, imagining what had happened there on April 27, 2012.

The percentage of overweight and obese adults in Lancashire is almost 1 % higher than the national average ( 64.7 % compared with 63.8 %), according to the latest figures published by Public Health England. The latest figures from the Health and Social Care Information Centre’s survey of adults’ height and weight were published today (Wednesday, 17th June) and show that 65.5 per cent of adults in Lancashire are now overweight or obese, compared to 66.5% nationally. Lancashire’s increase of 0.6 percentage points is much higher than the national increase of 0.1%.

The U.S. government is charging that Google is systematically paying women less than their male counterparts. Testifying in a San Francisco court Friday, Department of Labor (DOL) regional director Janette Wipper said the government “found systemic compensation disparities against women pretty much across the entire workforce,” according to a report in The Guardian. The charges come as part of a lawsuit the DOL filed against Google in January, seeking access to the company’s compensation data and related personnel records. As a federal contractor, Google is required to permit the government to inspect records relevant to its compliance with equal opportunity laws.

Banking giant Standard Chartered on Tuesday announced a return of dividends for shareholders after a two-year hiatus as it reported a near 60 per cent rise in its annual profit. The firm also unveiled plans to raise up to $1 billion from a new share sale to support growth in developing markets and repay some of the bank's $4.4 billion worth of accumulated reserves built up in recent years. "As the bank continues to deliver strong earnings growth, it is appropriate to return value to our shareholders through the interim dividend and a share buy-back," said Jean-Yves Fillion, chief financial officer.

This is the ninth dispatch in a series from Jeff Goodell , who will be investigating the effect of climate change on our national forests over the next year. This dispatch comes from Rocky Mountain National Park in Colorado. Follow along at www.grist.org, or via Twitter (#jeffgoodell), and check back every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday for more dispatches. My wife, Heather, and I left our suburban home near Denver early this morning and drove up a two-lane country road to Estes Park, where we picked up our friend and colleague, George Haines, who writes for High Country News.

Can You Keep a Secret? is based on Sophie Kinsella’s 4-million-copy New York Times bestseller and centers on Emma Corrigan (Daddario), who spills her secrets to a handsome stranger sitting next to her on a turbulent plane ride. That guy happens to be Jack Harper (Hoechlin), the young and elusive CEO at Emma’s workplace. And Jack knows every single humiliating detail about Emma… . Elise Duran is directing Peter Hutchings’ adaptation. BCDF’s Claude Dal Farra, Brice Dal Farra and Brian Keady of BCDF Pictures are producing. Daddario and Charles Miller are executive producing.

AFC Fylde ’ s match at Torquay United has been postponed following a Friday morning pitch inspection at Plainmoor . Both clubs were disappointed with the conditions but after a further inspection at 10.45am, it was concluded the pitch was unplayable with both sets of players wary of potentially damaging knees and ankles if they were asked to play in such atrocious weather. The club will now seek a new date with Torquay, with the aim to reschedule for Saturday, April 27 at 3pm. “We were gutted when we had to call the game off on Friday afternoon ,” said chairman David Bosomworth.

In the greatest debate since the color of the dress, people are arguing over what color these pills are. The dress debate blew up online, with some people claiming it was white and gold while others thought it was blue and black. The reason was pegged as linked to how one’s retinas function. Now everyone is arguing over the color of these pills, in a picture widely circulated online over Twitter, Facebook, and other websites. The photo shows two hands holding a pill each, with one hand colored yellow and the other blue.

One 15-year-old girl from Russia loved sharing her image on social media. She would take selfies whenever the mood struck her, which was often, and then share them via her phone with her friends, followers, and the world at large. But Karina Baymukhambetova was killed when she stepped in front of a speeding train in Orsk to get the best selfie of her life. Moments after she told her relative to “be afraid of nothing in life,” the train slammed into the teenager and left her body “cut to pieces” in the devastating aftermath.

Carrying-case manufacturer Skooba announced Thursday that it's working with the Transportation Security Administration on new laptop bags that can pass through airport security without having the computer inside removed. Carrying-case manufacturer Skooba--the same company that brought the world the slightly mocking Skreener bag --announced Thursday that it's working with the Transportation Security Administration on new laptop bags that can pass through airport security without having the computer inside removed. "If all goes well, this will be very welcome news for many tech-travelers.," the company stated in a release issued today.

Running errands on your bicycle is a great way to burn calories and get some exercise . When you need to keep track of your distance or calories, it is a breeze. All you need to do is attach a pedometer to your bike. This will record the miles, speed, and time. For calories burned, you need a calorie coun... This article will explain what a calorie burner is, and will show you a few different ways you can measure the number of calories burned, and how to calculate your calories expended during the day for each activity you do.

Known as a “ floating fest , ” Lake Wylie Music Fest has performers on land at a private residence and water performers in pontoon boats on the lake. Because there is no stage in the water, performances are limited to what can fit on the boats — and there is limited seating for spectators. Fortunately, the lake is wide enough to accommodate many small vessels. This year’s festival will have three pontoon boats full of performers, plus others on land. There will be 10 musical performers throughout the day, and several others will provide their art in painting, sculpture, and photography.

( Reuters ) - British serviced office space provider IWG Plc said on Wednesday it would close or refurbish some of its underperforming offices, which could impact the number of offices it operates. The company - whose brands include No. 18 and Regus - had been under pressure to address weak demand in markets it serves, such as the United States, where the economy was hit by the fallout from the financial crisis. It said it will close 61 underperforming sites worldwide during the next 18 months, with 28 of these being closed or closed down by the end of this year.

Four detection stations throughout the Large Hadron Collider will help gather huge amounts of information about what happens during each particle collision. Each of these four "LHC experiments" — ATLAS, CMS, TOTEM, and CMS-TRELA — will record data from the protons crashing head-on. The data will provide a wealth of information about matter and antimatter, the nature of gravity, the mass of elementary particles like protons, electrons and quarks, and many other fundamental properties and interactions of nature. These are some of the most important questions in modern science, and ATLAS, CMS and LHCb have already begun their explorations of the unknown.

Chipolo Plus is supposedly the loudest Bluetooth item tracker available today, and its chirpy tune can be heard from a greater distance than other similar trackers. Thanks to some useful new tech, items gone missing around the house or office can announce their locations with chirpy ditties — as long as they have Bluetooth trackers attached and you're close enough to hear the trackers' songs. So can you tell the difference between those dB levels? In my tests, I could indeed hear Chipolo Plus a little bit better than the other trackers, though the difference is subtle.

The Frewsburg Central School board of education received an update Thursday on the capital project that began last spring. The primary work of the capital project involved the renovation and upgrades to the auditorium, the bleachers, the press box, science classrooms, high school offices and air conditioning in classrooms. The project allowed for the budgeting of four alternate projects if the total budget had enough room for the additions. The district, according to Jerome Lee Yaw, administrative team member, will be able to complete three of the four alternate projects.

BETHANY , Okla. -- A hospital for disabled children in Bethany has organized an Olympic Games for their young residents. Kīlauea continues to erupt at its summit and East Rift Zone . During the past week , the summit lava lake level ranged from 118-177 feet below the vent rim, and the lava lake surface was at 320 feet below the summit crater rim. At Puʻu ʻŌʻō, the lava flow was active on the upper Pulama pali slope on May 23. The level of the summit lava lake was 100 feet (31 m) below the rim on May 23. A new lava pond was active for a few minutes during a helicopter overflight on May 21, but the level was not measured.

A Manitoba woman has been sent to prison for hiding the remains of six infants in a rented storage locker in Alberta. Judge agrees with Crown: woman hid infant corpses in storage unit

What will happen to a living organism placed in a state of quantum superposition ? September 22 , 2015 , 10:30 AM
Quantum mechanics describes the physics of very small particles. When quantum particles are viewed, or “observed”, their physical state changes and the particles behave as if they are in a superposition of their state before and after “observation”. For example, a particle may have an energy state of 9 and 11. It is impossible to define the particle’s energy state without a measurement. Once it is measured, the particle is found to be in either 9 or 11.

Most Janus cats do n't live for more than a few days , but Frank and Louie 's unusually long lifespan has caused a lot of debate . The Janus Cat is a genetically engineered hybrid of a lion and a tiger. Both species are of the cat family. The cat family is a sub family of the family felidae. This sub family is further divided into six families. These are Felinae , the sub family of Felis, which includes domesticated cats, and the sub families Pantherinae , Pardinae , Ocelotinae , and Acinonychinae. The Felinae are further divided into 2 sub families.

The Texas Supreme Court has transferred about 80 cases from El Paso 's 8th Court of Appeals in a first-of-its-kind decision that aims to improve access to justice for El Pasoans. Cases from the El Paso 8th Court of Appeals will be moved to the Texas' highest court for consideration, as a first step toward possible reversal of prior rulings. The Texas Supreme Court announced the decision in an order Thursday, according to the Texas Lawyer. The move comes after a report from the court's taskforce on civil access to the court recommended the transfer of civil appeals from El Paso, San Antonio and Dallas courts.

How will fuel prices and driving in Europe be affected by Brexit? Following the momentous decision taken today by United Kingdom voters to leave the European Union, a British motoring association has warned fuel prices, driving in Europe and motor insurance could all be affected. The “digital workforce” may sound like science fiction, conjuring up images of lines of robots running through an office. In truth, the digital workforce is a tangible reality. But, rather than teams of robots, it involves a more promising environment with people, automation, and artificial intelligence working side by side. This hybrid workforce is coming to life thanks to businesses that recognize the transformative potential in automation and AI. In a study by Genpact of 300 C-suite and senior executives, 79% of AI leaders – the companies generating impact from AI – expect their employees to be comfortable working alongside robots by 2020.

WASHINGTON — House Democrats on Friday unveiled a comprehensive elections and ethics reform package that targets what they call a “culture of corruption in Washington” and aims to reduce the role of money in politics. The bill, among the first to be considered as Democrats take control of the House after eight years, would make it easier for citizens to register and vote, tighten election security and require presidents to disclose their tax returns. Dubbed the “For the People Act,” the legislation marks an effort by Democrats to set a tone of good government as they take the majority following historic gains in the midterm elections.

(CNN) -- France's Michel Desjoyeaux won the Vendee Globe solo round the world yacht race for a record second time on Sunday. Desjoyeaux crosses the line in triumph at Les Sables to win his second Vendee Globe. He crossed the line off Les Sables d'Olonne in a time of 84 days, three hours, nine minutes and eight seconds to smash the race record by over three days and claim a 150,000 euros first prize. Desjoyeaux first won the sailing classic in 2001 and emerged victorious again after an incident-packed race which saw two French competitors dramatically rescued.

CBS President and CEO Les Moonves has pushed for rights to stream NFL games on the network 's digital service starting next season. CBS airs Thursday night games this season. CBS says it has reached a deal to live-stream Thursday night NFL games on its digital service next season. CBS (NYSE:CBS) made the announcement late Monday. The network is airing Thursday night games this season, and says it has a long-term contract to keep airing the late games on the traditional broadcast network starting in 2014. The network also says the deal is with the NFL, and not the league's network broadcast partners.

BATON ROUGE—Secretary of State Kyle Ardoin is warning voters to be aware of who they discuss their private information with, especially during the upcoming early voting period, according to a recent press release. Early voting in Louisiana begins Tuesday and runs until Saturday, Feb. 29. Voter lists are confidential, Ardoin said, but that does not stop criminals from stealing that information for illegal purposes. Louisiana Code of Criminal Procedure, Article 3701, makes it illegal for anyone to obtain, publish or in any manner reveal the name of a voter who voted by absentee ballot, or his or her voting location.

The University of Arkansas at Fort Smith recently told student Jennifer Braly that she was prohibited from giving lectures about being transgender to classes on campus, despite the fact that faculty were eager to feature her presentations. Braly suspected it was because she had sued the school for other forms of discrimination she faced. This week, the university reversed its policy restricting Braly to gender-neutral bathrooms after the Department of Justice sent a letter on her behalf. Trans students will now be able to use the bathroom corresponding to the gender with which they identify.

Ontario’s Special Investigations Unit has ended its investigation into the death of a 43-year-old Rideau Lakes man who allegedly shot himself after receiving a phone call from police. The incident occurred on the afternoon of June 3, in the Township of Rideau Lakes, just west of Smiths Falls, when an Ontario Provincial Police officer contacted the man and told him he would be arrested. Shortly afterward, at 3:20 p.m., the man called 911 reporting that he had sustained a self-inflicted gunshot wound. Police and paramedics responded to the call and the man was taken to Ottawa Civic Hospital by air ambulance.

LITCHFIELD , Maine ( AP ) — A Maine woman is trying to protect a series of osprey nests atop utility poles after an electric company plans to remove them. Maine Public reports a spokesman with Bangor Hydro-Electric says the nests pose a risk to the power company, and they’ve received complaints from neighbors in Litchfield. The utility says the nests need to be removed to prevent wildlife and tree hazards. However, Diane Weed of the Friends of Baxter State Park says the company should find an alternative location. Weed says there’s been a nest on every utility pole along Main Street since at least 1996.

For Bruce Logan , microbes are an electrifying subject . The Kappe professor of environmental engineering at Pennsylvania State University's Center for Electro- and Intelligent Systems , Logan has devoted his career to studying how microbes interact with one another, how they affect their surroundings, and how their behavior can be programmed for a variety of beneficial uses. Most recently, Logan's lab has been exploring how to engineer electrochemical bacteria for applications as diverse as biofilm sensors and the production of hydrogen fuel . Logan is also known for his interest in bioremediation , the field of research devoted to using living organisms to treat pollution from industrial sites or sewage spills.

The Manitoba government is promising $140,000 in funding for the St. Norbert Heritage Committee's campaign to conserve the 178-year-old St. Norbert Abbey. The committee is applying for funding from the Community Places Program which will be administered by the Province in partnership with the Winnipeg Foundation and other community partners. The $10-million Community Places program will provide $2.5 million this year, with the money to be matched with another $2.5 million in funding from other partners.

Smith, Marc Choueiti, & Dr. Katherine Pieper at the USC Annenberg School of Communications, looked at G, PG and PG-13 rated movies that were released in the US.

There's a new product from Pace Products. it's a 110-volt, variable-speed, water-cooling chuck that can hold a 6-inch knife, and it's just what you need if you like to throw knives on your projects. It works like this: You set the knife to the desired speed with the dial on the machine, and then lock the knife in place with the large bolt.

Todd P , one of the city 's top local independent music promoters , helped open up a new venue a few weeks ago to showcase some of the area's best musicians. Having spent the last twenty years promoting local live music, Todd saw a need to provide a place where young, up and coming artists, could perform in front of a live and supportive local crowd. The venue is a co-working space called The Painted Space, which is open six days per week for artists, photographers, graphic designers, illustrators and more.

Who pulled the plug on the canal this time ? It ’ s winter , and we ’ re certainly not swimming in the canal ! On 21st February 2013 the Canal & River Trust issued a Press Release which stated, “The Trust has agreed to work with the National Grid to explore whether there is an option for an underground cable in place of the new 400kV overhead transmission cable that will cross the canal near Langford Lock, Bedfordshire. “We have made it very clear to the National Grid that we think this is a better option for the canal and our plans for this stretch of waterway.

If you live along the Eastern Seaboard and wake up early Friday you could be treated to a colorful sky. NASA scientists say a strong storm is moving towards the Northeast. The storms are carrying a lot of dust into the atmosphere and if the winds are strong enough you could be treated to an aurora. The storm is moving through the Rockies and will continue to the East until it makes landfall. If you are on the East Coast this weekend pay attention to what color your sunrise and sunset are. You might be able to see something very cool.

Amazon.com 's purchase of Austin-based Whole Foods Market is showing up in the wine category . As this year ends, Amazon is moving to lower prices on many wine items, including organic wines, sparkling wines, and wines from its private label. It's also lowering prices on other items, including prepared foods, bulk foods, bakery items, meat, produce, seafood and beer and liquor. The online giant is doing it to compete with rivals in the grocery business such as Wal-Mart and Walgreen's and to attract shoppers, many of whom spend more money at grocery stores than at traditional department stores such as Macy's .

Security researchers at Kaspersky Lab say they 've discovered the first virus designed to infect iPods . Called `` Podloso.A,'' the infection was found on the iTunes Store Web site. The malware was designed to steal credit card information from users by redirecting them to phishing sites, which are sites created by criminals to look like legitimate online retailers. The virus is also capable of spreading to other Web sites, such as Gmail, Flickr, YouTube, and others, and steals login information and other sensitive data. In a blog posting about the discovery, Kaspersky security researcher Randy Abrams said that Podloso isn't particularly sophisticated.

Syrian sources said April 14 that the Jordanian charge d'affaires in Lebanon , Hisham Moheisen , who was kidnapped from Damascus to Amman , was handed over to Jordan. The Lebanese Shi'ite newspaper al-Akhbar said Moheisen was handed over on April 14 and added that the group had threatened to execute him within 48 hours if the Jordanian government did not comply. Al-Akhbar claimed that the Syrian opposition's "Martyr's Brigade" had kidnapped Moheisen on March 30, shortly after he met with a senior Syrian official in Damascus to discuss the situation of 13 Jordanian pilgrims that had recently been detained in Syria .

Salads from McDonald's have been linked to more than 500 cases of an intestinal illness in the US. More than 500 people in the US have become sick with an intestinal illness after eating McDonald's salads, according to health officials. US federal health officials have confirmed more than 500 cases of the intestinal illness linked to the salads. The illnesses reported earlier this year are linked to the cyclospora parasite, which can cause diarrhoea, intestinal pain, nausea or tiredness. The Food and Drug Administration said on Friday that 507 cases have been confirmed in 15 states and New York City.

Who is K P Sharma Oli? The new prime minister of Nepal, K P Sharma Oli gained popularity in the 1990s for his efforts in the democratic movement that brought down the Panchayat regime. In the next few years, he became a key figure in Nepali politics. Two months after the successful conclusion of the historic parliamentary polls in Nepal, the winning party, CPN-UML on Thursday chose party chairman K P Sharma Oli as the country’s next prime minister. Oli (65) had previously served a prime ministerial term from October 11, 2015, to August 3, 2016.

The best retirement financial advice you can get might be to get more sleep . That is the provocative implication of a new survey that found the most important financial decisions made by retirees are not so much driven by financial considerations. The study, conducted by Fidelity Investments, finds that retirees typically make major financial choices in their later years based on their own happiness and well-being, including a preference for living with a small amount of financial worry rather than a big financial nest egg. This preference for happiness and well-being appears more pronounced for those who are wealthy.

Carrying-case manufacturer Skooba announced Thursday that it 's working with the Transportation Security Administration on new laptop bags that can be opened and searched in a manner that is compliant with current TSA rules. Skooba products are not yet available at the TSA's web site, although the agency has said it plans to make such bags available. "We've spent a considerable amount of time and resources developing these new laptop bags specifically to meet TSA’s requirements," company CEO Mark Goldston said. He added: "I don’t think there are any others out there that comply to the new standards yet.

Born in the country and fluent in the language , Gursewak Singh considers himself Japanese . The government does n't. After spending the better part of the last 24 years in Japan, Mr Singh, 35, has been denied a visa to work in the country. His Japanese wife, Akane, was also denied a visa despite having worked in Japan for over a decade. Akane, 35 , is the only child of Mr Atsushi Aoyama and Mr Aiko Aoyama who have been staying in Japan since 1980. Born in Japan, Akane has not visited India since she first came to the country from Osaka at age 10.

Firefighters more progressive in how we're using information to gear how we make our decisions within the community. TEMPE, AZ — When you think of essential firefighting tools, an iPad may not be top of mind. Now, more than ever, first responders are using those devices to collect a plethora of information, in real time, during an emergency. When Tempe firefighter and paramedic Nelson Goossens is not treating patients during a call, he is likely inputting information. A lot of it. "It definitely affects everything we do," said Goossens.

ASTANA, Kazakhstan—Nursultan Nazarbayev, Kazakhstan’s first and only president, resigned on Tuesday, ending his nearly 30-year reign and setting the stage for an opaque succession process in the oil-rich Central Asian country of 18 million people. As his speech hinted, Nazarbayev’s departure from office will not mean giving up the reins of power. The aging leader, who has led Kazakhstan since 1989, when it was still part of the Soviet Union, said that Kassym-Jomart Tokayev, the speaker of the Senate and a trusted political ally of Nazarbayev, will take over as acting president until new elections are held in 2020.

The Jawbone Up debuted last year with big ambitions: A bracelet-like device that you'd wear all the time, tracking how much you move and how well you sleep. Paired with an app, the Up helps you recognize patterns in your habits, empowering you to improve your health. One problem: It wasn't built to withstand the punishment of being a wearable device. Unlike a cellphone that resides in your pocket or a bag, the Up wraps around your wrist, exposed to the world just as much as your skin is. Many users found it quickly malfunctioned, and Jawbone recalled the Up and issued refunds.

The newest entry to the robo-advisory service is TIAA . Part of the allure for firms is to appeal to the mass market. Robo-advice, after all, is all about the mass market, which means attracting large numbers of customers with low-cost investment services. The second major trend, according to the TIAA report, is a “reconceptualization of retirement advice as a life journey.” In this view, there are a variety of financial goals to be met at various life stages that can be accomplished with the right mix of guidance and automation.

WASHINGTON — Thousands of commuters across the region were delayed Thursday morning by an apparent work action by Metro ’s custodial staff. The Washington Post reports that a union representing Metro’s housekeeping staff issued a no-show ultimatum in the middle of a work slowdown. The custodial workers walked off the job, staged sit-ins at stations and vandalized equipment, Metro said. Metro is the third largest subway system in the country and is the second largest in the world. It is the only way to get around Washington, D.C. The work slowdown affected the Red, Orange and Blue lines during morning rush-hour.

ANAHEIM , Calif. / Oct. 26 , 2000—Stephen F. Bollenbach , president and chief executive officer of Hilton Hotels Corp. , announced today that he will be leaving his position as chief executive officer of the world's largest and most recognized hotel company to accept the role of chairman and chief executive officer of the Walt Disney Co. , where he will lead the company in its expansion of the Disney theme park and resort business throughout the world. Under Mr. Bollenbach's leadership, Hilton Hotels grew from $3 billion in 1997 revenue to $5.2 billion last year and from 273,000 rooms to 295,000 today.

An online portal aimed at ensuring that the Muslim community gets religious knowledge from recognised sources was launched yesterday by Deputy Prime Minister Tharcisco Tavares. Speaking at the launch of “Pure Islam,” the deputy leader of the ruling Democratic Progressive Party said the information on the website should not be considered a threat to the traditional mosques or Islamic preachers, but rather an opportunity. “This is not to challenge the traditional Mosques or Islamic teachers but to offer an opportunity for the Islamic community, especially to the younger generation who have the right to get information through different means,” said Tavares.

Weld District Attorney Ken Buck ’ s U.S. Senate bid is reportedly coming to an end . Sources have told The Denver Post that Buck will not be seeking a U.S. Senate seat . He has been widely reported to be considering a run for a Senate seat, as a candidate for the seat currently held by Michael Bennet . Buck was elected to his current position as Weld County district attorney in ’ 06 . He received his J.D. degree from the University of Wyoming in ’ 00 . He is a graduate of the University of Northern Colorado , from which he received his B.A.

Former police officer Drew Peterson threw his wife to the floor one night , grabbed her throat and told her, “You’re gonna be my bitch,” the prosecution alleged. It was evidence presented at a pretrial hearing Friday in Peterson’s felony perjury trial. Peterson has not been charged in his third wife’s 2007 disappearance and authorities have not named any suspects in the case. But prosecutors contend Peterson is a suspect in Stacy Peterson’s disappearance and that he tried to cover it up by lying to police.

A mother forges her son 's signature on a letter of intent . A newly committed Georgia player hoists a scholarship offer from a big-name program. An All-American gets caught in the middle of a scandal. Each of these real-life scenarios plays out on the college-bound recruiting circuit each year. And while the vast majority of recruits and their families act with integrity, a small percentage of athletic programs and schools, desperate to get an edge in the highly competitive race for the country's best players, cross the line in the hunt for elite prospects.

On April 22, 2014, Hollingsworth was supposed to drop off 20-month-old Aurora Aryana Hollingsworth at a child-care center about 7:30 a.m. But he “forgot her in the car,” according to an arrest warrant affidavit filed by a North Richland Hills police investigator. “This is a disabled veteran who had several things on his mind that day and just forgot,” Lex Johnston of Hurst, Hollingsworth’s attorney, said Tuesday. Johnston said Hollingsworth’s daughter and four children were living with him, and he took the daughter to work, paid for child care and drove the grandchildren to day care or school.

The British are known for their collective stiff upper lip. The elements of British style translate easily in every region, even in the subtropics. A comfortable armchair, slipcovers, small prints, antiques and wicker furniture are all British touches that look good anywhere. -- Slipcovers. On sofas, on chairs, on pillows. ''Chintzes and paisleys look great even in this climate,'' said Melissa B. Luetgert of Designers Age in Naples, Fla.
-- Patterns. Leafy designs, white-on-white and chintzes are showing up on upholstery, wall coverings and accent pieces.
