WASHINGTON — House Democrats on Friday unveiled a comprehensive elections and ethics reform package that targets what they call a campaign finance system “rigged” for special interests. But while they argue the bill would strengthen the government ethics office and end “dark money,” the plan contains some major exceptions. “This bill is just the beginning,” said Rep. Donna Edwards (D-Md. ), who helped author the legislation. “This is a very important bill,” she added. “The way our campaign finance system works now is it favors the most wealthy among us and favors corporations….

Fish oil . Protein shakes . Vitamin D pills . The packages look alike . Does it matter which you take? It turns out it may, according to a study released today in the Journal of the American Medical Association, which showed that fish oil and protein shakes both improved heart health in a 1,000 person trial, but only fish oil had an effect on weight loss. The research team from the National Institutes of Health analyzed people who ate too much or were overweight. The goal was to test how fish oil, protein shakes, and vitamin D impacted body weight and the ability to use insulin.

The "Checkout with Instagram" feature could add $10 billion of revenue for Facebook in 2021, Deutsche Bank says. Instagram users can browse and purchase offerings from 23 top brands in the U.S.
"Facebook is investing heavily" in this e-commerce opportunity, Deutsche Bank says. Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg speaks about Instagram during a press event at Facebook headquarters. Facebook added a feature to make its Instagram platform a more efficient place for social media users to shop and buy, which Deutsche Bank believes "can drive monetization" further for the app.

LOS ANGELES ( AP ) — The Oscars are adding a new category to honor popular films and promising a brisk three-hour show. The Academy Awards will introduce an Oscar for outstanding achievement in popular film at next year’s ceremony, organizers said Wednesday. The change is intended to recognize blockbusters that “inspire, influence and entertain audiences around the world” and acknowledge the “artistry of all of those contributions,” Academy President John Bailey and CEO Dawn Hudson said in an academy statement. Bailey and Hudson said they expect the changes will shorten the show.

The future leadership of Volkswagen hangs in the balance today as the 20-member board of the troubled and iconic company meets to decide critical issues including who the next CEO will be in the wake of Martin Winterkorn‘s resignation earlier this week and how deep the cuts must go into the ranks of executives held responsible — along with the action plan to win back the trust of shocked customers and government regulators. Meanwhile, other top-level action continues as European regulators begin delving into VW’s emissions behaviors and as 27 state attorneys general in the United States develop a potential criminal case against the German automaker.

Jill McGown, who has died aged 59 from cancer, was one of the generation of crime writers who shifted the genre firmly into the contemporary world. Although she held fast to the traditional skill of well-crafted plots, she brought a modern perspective to characters and situations, creating a series of thoughtful and engaging police procedurals. She will be best remembered for the 13 novels featuring Chief Inspector Danny Lloyd and Sergeant Judy Hill. Theirs was a relationship that encompassed the personal as well as the professional, and Jill's deft handling of its development was one of the keynote elements of the books.

Let’s dispense with the question of whether Democrat Ralph Northam is being treated unfairly. His grievous political wounds — by Monday, virtually all Democratic Party luminaries in the state and most Democratic presidential hopefuls had called on him to resign — are self-inflicted. When the photograph from Northam’s Eastern Virginia Medical School yearbook surfaced Friday, his first reaction was to issue a statement of abject apology. Tactically, in terms of crisis management, that was the right move — own the transgression and say unambiguously that you’re sorry.

Following a team of international scientists, this film exclusively documents an archeological sensation: the exploration of royal tombs beneath the ancient Mexican city of Teotihuacán. Despite many decades of research, not much is known about the long-lost Teotihuacán society. But when archeologists enter the newly discovered burial chambers, they find the clues that may finally tell us who these mysterious people were. The film incorrectly states the city of Tikal is in Mexico when it is in Guatemala. Secrets of the Dead strives to get the facts correct and we regret the error.

Weber (Forest Whitaker) and a few soldiers arrive at acclaimed linguist Louise Banks’s (Amy Adams) doorstep to bring her to speak with the aliens. The aliens, large cephalopod-like creatures, nicknamed heptapods due to their seven appendages, can speak, but not in any language that humanity can understand. Banks, along with Ian Donnelly (Jeremy Renner), regularly meets with the aliens at the ship that appeared in U.S. airspace in an attempt to establish communication.

The Defense Information Systems Agency has provided and operated telecommunications and information technology for decades. Today the Agency is sharpening its operational focus working with its partner, the Joint Task Force-Global Network Operations (JTF-GNO). Together DISA and the JTF-GNO provide a mission environment for warfighters and national leadership that comprises command and control capabilities and the entire enterprise infrastructure. The term 'operationalizing' refers to doing this with a no-fail customer-focused mindset, and a shift from an application mentality to a service mentality. This is critical to fielding Global Information Grid 2.0 capabilities that will deliver a next generation Web 2.0 environment for the warfighter.

FERGUSON, MO (KPLR) - The crisis in Ferguson has left residents on edge, especially the elderly and the disabled. Many are afraid to leave their homes to go to doctor's appointments and to the grocery store. Representative from Better Family Life set up a tent at Canfield Green Apartment, where 18-year-old Michael Brown was shot and killed by Ferguson Police Officer Darren Wilson more than a week ago. Representatives are offering free blood pressure checks, food, diapers, toiletries, and school supplies to residents in need. They are also providing financial assistance to those who need to buy medications.

Many Alberta small-business owners , who have been struggling through a prolonged economic downturn , are hoping the next provincial budget , to be released Tuesday, will provide some relief. The Edmonton Chamber of Commerce has outlined five priorities: tax reductions, support for business investment, training and apprenticeships, skills development and a “fairer” tax structure. “The government has heard our calls and is making significant investments into programs and initiatives that will support businesses and workers,” the chamber said. The Alberta government will release the 2016 budget at 2 p.m. (Mountain time) Tuesday in Edmonton.

The proxy owner and publicity officer of a private event-organising company, who were arrested on charges of organising the Wadduwa beach party where four people died, were today remanded till August 17 by Panadura Additional Magistrate Kalhari Liyanage. The suspects, Amila Pushpakumara and Eranda Danthanarayana were produced in Court by the Wadduwa Police Crime Branch Sub Inspector K.A.S.W. Sugath. Submitting the report on the police investigations, he said the Government Analyst and Assistant Government Analyst visited the hotel and conducted investigations. SI Sigath said the police also carried out an investigation into the tragedy that occurred at the beach party on August 4 attended by some 2,000 people.

The word hero gets thrown around so much that its use has lost much of the intended impact . Indie authors, who are often the least well-represented and underestimated contributors to the world of storytelling, can use heroic language to connect with an audience. Whether you're writing an original work or one based in a particular mythology or fandom, these heroic archetypes can help you to write a more inspiring and memorable protagonist. According to Carl Jung, archetypes are patterns of behavior that are found in mythologies around the world and in modern day society.

An Austrian man has nearly burned down his home in an attempt to get rid of a mouse . The unnamed resident set his own house alight with a flammable liquid he made himself on Sunday, the BBC reports. Police were called to the blaze in Ried im Innkreis at around 10:30 local time (08:00 GMT) and discovered the man’s attempts to flush the animal out. Officers then had to rescue the 35-year-old from his burning home and take him to hospital to treat his injuries. The Austrian media have been speculating that the flammable liquid used by the man may have been gasoline or similar.

Barack Obama ’ s presidency has coincided with immense growth of social media services like Facebook and Twitter . And while it’s not a surprise that Obama is leading the way in this area , it is interesting to consider just how well Obama’s social media team has done . Social media is a two-way communication channel and so the key to good engagement is good listening . As part of the White House social media strategy, the social media team have developed an approach to respond to comments and suggestions . On the 2008 Presidential Election website, Obama asked users to suggest ways to “get involved” .

With the win, the Lady Bombers (18-4, 11-2) moved one-half game behind Mountain Home for the top spot in the South Central District. The Lady Bombers will close the regular season on the road Friday night at Harrison. Despite the low-scoring nature of the contest, Mountain Home never trailed.

Over the next few months , many federal employees will receive performance ratings . Some may believe their ratings to be low and may wonder what is being used to judge their work. Most agencies use various management tools to support their decisions on what to rate and how to rate employees, but the most significant factor is the performance appraisal form itself and how it is rated by managers. This article focuses on a tool used by managers when making performance appraisal ratings; the Performance Standard. The article will describe how managers use the performance standard and the importance of their use.

Today marks the 314th anniversary of the last Cascadia Subduction Zone earthquake . Geological records indicate that this 9.0 magnitude quake has happened in the past approximately every 240 years. According to a study from Oregon State University , there is an 80% probability that a magnitude 8.0 or larger quake will occur in this region within the next 50 years. Although this information is unsettling, preparing for the next disaster has never been more important. In the event that the Cascadia Subduction Zone does trigger a massive tsunami, emergency officials are ready to act immediately.

California Communities Demand `` Rent Control Now ! '' Efforts to stabilize communities in California with with much needed rent control legislation are continuing to grow and expand into other urban areas such as Los Angeles, and the Bay Area. According to a 2016 California housing survey, 62% of residents say that they experience housing cost burdens, while 62% of renters report that they are "severely rent burdened, meaning they pay at least 50% of their incomes in rent. California has the fifth highest rate of rent burden in the country.

CBS President and CEO Les Moonves has pushed for rights to stream NFL games on the network's digital service. CBS Corp. said it obtained rights to carry National Football League games on its CBS All Access streaming service, allowing the most-watched U.S. TV network to offer its most popular programming online. The multiyear deal with the NFL begins Sunday and will include all CBS coverage of regular, preseason and post-season games in subscribers’ local markets, the network said Thursday in a statement. Financial terms weren’t disclosed. While NFL viewership has declined this year, football remains the most popular programming on TV.

BATON ROUGE—Secretary of State Kyle Ardoin is warning voters to be aware of who they discuss their private information with in light of a potential voter registration scam that surfaced this week. While our office has not received reports of the potential scam in Louisiana, election officials in several states have confirmed residents receiving calls impersonating an organization that provides voter registration assistance. The callers are offering to register residents over the phone, and in some cases, to send the voter an absentee ballot. In Louisiana, residents cannot register to vote or request an absentee ballot by phone.

There were two dividing impulses in Robin Williams's performances that could, roughly, be called his American and British sides. On the American side, there was the slushy tendency towards sentimentality, for which he became increasingly known, which, at its best, resulted in Dead Poets Society, The Birdcage and Mrs Doubtfire, and, at its worst, became Patch Adams and Old Dogs. Hollywood has long had a tendency to adopt the finest and most interesting comedians and then determinedly blunt the hard edges that make them interesting. Along with Richard Pryor, Williams was the most obvious example of that.

Timeshare management companies foreclose on homeowners who do not pay the bill . 1 Can I Be Sued for Not Having a Timeshare? When the timeshare owner stops paying the monthly maintenance fee and property taxes, the timeshare management companies forecloses on the property. A mortgage lender is not entitled to enforce a timeshare mortgage after it is paid off by the timeshare association or timeshare management company. An owner’s right to occupancy terminates at the end of the last period the owner owns. If a timeshare management company owns the property, the owner can be evicted from the property, but the timeshare association is prohibited from doing so.

In true Colorado fashion , Fort Collins ' first full week of spring will bring below-freezing temperatures on the heels of an April 1 snowfall. Forecasters predict the first full week of March will be chilly with temperatures hovering around the 40s and 50s, but it's nothing compared with last spring. The city's coldest spring came in 2002 when temperatures hit 23 degrees and snow fell on Easter weekend. The first full week of April 2008 also brought freezing temperatures, but the snow came later and melted on April 9 — the first day the temperature reached 70 degrees.

The Bermuda Police Service warned people of fraudsters trying to get their personal information from phone calls or e-mails . Police said that the scams can include impersonating police officers asking for money, or asking for bank account or other personal information as part of a request for a refund or a grant. They also warn of impostors who call to say a loved one needs bail money or needs money for some other emergency, and they request a bank account or credit card number to transfer the money. Police also advise the public to be wary of e-mails that include links that can install malicious computer code.

The 2014 Chevrolet Camaro Z28. DETROIT — General Motors is recalling more cars for problems with ignition switches. GM is recalling nearly 512,000 Chevrolet Camaro muscle cars from the 2010 to 2014 model years. A driver's knee can bump the key and knock the switch out of the "run" position, causing an engine stall. That knocks out power steering and brakes and could cause drivers to lose control. GM said it knows of three crashes and four minor injuries from the problem. The company added that the Camaro switches met its specifications, unlike the switches at the center of a recall of 2.6 million small cars.

Jill McGown , who has died aged 59 from cancer , was one of the generation of crime writers who helped make the crime novel a respectable form of literature at the end of the twentieth century. Jill McGown, author of bestselling thrillers like The Girl in the Cellar [Getty]
McGown was a prolific novelist, producing 17 books from 1992 until her death and selling more than five million copies. Her most famous creation is the reluctant private detective and former police detective Annie Carter. The series, which was adapted for ITV as the series Peak Practice in 1993, was McGown's biggest success.

In 1972 the 12 black ships and their occupants crash on a beach near Point Reyes California . 2 of the ships land in 1973 and another 19 in 1974 .

The decision on 15 December 2005 in the case of Jones v Garnett was a victory for the taxpayer and a blow for HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC). The case concerned a husband and wife, Geoff and Diana Jones, and their company, Arctic Systems, which was set up in 1992. In common with family businesses' tax planning and on the advice of their accountants, one share was issued to Mrs Jones and one share to Mr Jones. The company was used to exploit the personal services of Mr Jones as an IT consultant.

ASTANA , Kazakhstan—Nursultan Nazarbayev , Kazakhstan ’ s first and only president , resigned on Tuesday , ending his nearly three-decade long rule in a country of 18.4 million people . At 58 , the authoritarian leader was a young political reformer who led Kazakhstan after the country won independence after the breakup of the Soviet Union. By the time he resigned , the nation had become a global energy giant and its economy had grown to rival that of its former master Russia . But as the country became more affluent and Westernized , its authoritarian nature and poor human rights record caused growing criticism from inside and outside the country.

To any objective observer , the consensus that exists between Barack Obama and Mitt Romney on the fundamental issues of foreign policy should be obvious: they agree with one another, they share their goals, they seek to pursue those objectives by identical methods. The only differences lie in two areas: the degree of each candidate’s willingness to use military force, and the speed at which they would proceed. Obama has consistently proven himself to be a more cautious politician and Romney’s own statements suggest that if he were elected, he would move more quickly to confront Russia and China.

PARIS -- France could become the latest country to ban the use of underweight fashion models . France 's health minister is studying a draft law that would make it an offence to employ models who are dangerously thin, the minister said Thursday. The draft law, drawn up by a group of doctors and sociologists, would target the fashion and cosmetics industries, which have been under fire around the world for promoting dangerous and unrealistic body standards. The draft law comes a month after Italian lawmakers approved a bill to outlaw underweight models on catwalk and in ads, following similar legislative moves in Israel, Brazil and Spain .

Voting for the eight phase of panchayat elections has begun across the state amidst heightened security. Polling is scheduled to end at 2 PM today. While 43 sarpanch and 681 panch have been elected unopposed, polling will take place for 331 sarpanch and 2007 panch seats, with 6304 candidates in the fray. An electorate of 5,15,121 will be voting for sarpanch constituencies and 4,19,775 for panch constituencies. In this phase, 2633 polling stations have been set up - 550 in Kashmir division and 2083 in Jammu division. Of these, 361 have been categorised as 'hypersensitive', including 171 in Kashmir division and 190 in Jammu division.

What's the difference between bipolar I and bipolar II? Bipolar disorder is a mental health condition that causes abnormally high and in some cases, low moods. It affects a person's energy levels and their ability to function in everyday life. There are several types of bipolar disorder, the most widespread being bipolar I and bipolar II. In this article, learn about the similarities and differences between bipolar I and bipolar II. We also consider their causes, symptoms, and the available treatment options. A person with bipolar disorder may experience extreme changes in mood.

Cryptocurrencies, outside of Bitcoin, have failed to garner much attention from buyers, and while the same can be said of sellers, the digestion of losses over the past month is likely to lead to more losses soon. Ethereum, Ripple, and Litecoin are all carving out a similar bear-flag pattern that should lead to another purge of speculative excesses. Weak price action in ETH/USD has it set up to make another leg lower soon. It could continue to drift ever-so-slightly higher, but the developing bear-flag implies risk is skewed more heavily towards the downside.

ROCHESTER – Nathan Bastian scored the game-winning goal as the Binghamton Devils defeated the Rochester Americans in overtime, 4-3, in front of 8,367 at BlueCross Arena on Friday night. After 17 minutes of scoreless hockey, Rochester scored two goals just two minutes apart. William Borgen scored on a shot from the point that took a fluke bounce off the end wall and trickled in behind Cam Johnson for a 1-0 lead. Victor Olofsson made it 2-0 with 1:36 remaining in the first, beating Johnson on a breakaway opportunity after sneaking behind the defense and taking a pass from Kyle Criscuolo.

WARWICK — Chariho High won six bouts with pins and defeated Pilgrim, 62-18, in a Division I crossover wrestling match Thursday night. James Dougherty (160 pounds, 1:36), Ben Dougherty (170, 4:14), Cam Anderson (182, 1:15), Devin Shaw (220, 3:10) and Mike Phelps (285, 59 seconds) all won by pins. Kyle Merritt earned a major decision win at 138 (20-6) as did Jackson Bridge at 145 (13-5). Wade Husing (106), Dominic Bonnano (152) and Nate Marchione (195) received forfeits.

The team that brought you driverless cars and Siri is now fighting a new kind of war on information. In the world of internet memes, Instagram filters, and Photoshop, seeing is no longer believing. Everyone is a photographer or videographer once they have a smartphone in their hands, which often comes equipped with alteration tools already installed. But manipulations that started with cropping and teeth-whitening have spurred into the spread of misinformation. Parkland shooting survivor Emma Gonzalez is pictured ripping up a shooting range target, left. At right, a doctored photo circulated the Internet, depicting Gonzalez tearing apart the U.S. Constitution.

Sen. Cory Booker, the New Jersey Democrat who’s launched a bid for the White House in 2020, is reportedly dating actress Rosario Dawson. Dawson shared the news with TMZ on Thursday when they caught up with her at a Washington D.C.-area airport. The outlet shared a video of the encounter, during which the reporter noted that Dawson had been frequently visiting the nation’s capital and had “been hanging out with” Booker. The actress kept fairly mum on whether the pair was headed toward an engagement but offered an optimistic note on their relationship.

(Reuters) - For U.S. media companies and investors, it was the ruling of the decade. A federal judge in Washington had sole power to decide whether telecoms company AT&T Inc could buy Time Warner Inc, the parent of HBO, CNN and Warner Bros, for $85 billion and reshape the U.S. media landscape. After a six-week long trial, Judge Richard Leon set a hearing date of June 12 at 4 p.m. (2000 GMT) to announce his ruling. People were so keen to get a seat in his courtroom that they took turns standing in line more than 24 hours ahead of the event.

With Telstra, Optus or Vodafone taking care of connectivity, your business can focus on its own success – and the telecommunications industry is here to help. To find out more, read our guide to telecommunication. Telecommunication providers help connect customers to the internet, phone calls and more. Telcos: Telco service providers.

- Are these the phones Samsung plans to announce? We're two days into 2018 and already the new year is treating us well. Samsung is expected to launch the Galaxy S9 and S9+ in early 2018, so, of course, the leaks are coming full force, starting with renders from this morning, and, now, the first hands-on image of the two handsets. Perhaps the most ironic and scary part of the whole “Thank You” rally was the crowd’s silence when Trump mentioned that everyone should come together. The irony being that his campaign has been anything but unifying, which is why his supporters backed him. They’re tired of seeing this country’s demographics being changed, their white privilege being challenged. Unity and inclusion is far from what these people want — even after the election’s over. I left Cincinnati tired and disheveled, but perhaps mostly worried about our future.

Chrissy Teigen and John Legend arrive at the Oscars on Feb. 26, 2017 at the Dolby Theatre in Los Angeles. Chrissy Teigen is loving life on vacation and, judging by a new post, her hubby John Legend isn’t the only singer in the house. Teigen, the model and activist, shared a video of herself goofing around with an inflatable flamingo by a pool and singing “Thank You For Being A Friend,” the theme for The Golden Girls, a hugely popular sitcom in the 1980s and early 1990s. Teigen’s version has a fresh set of lyrics tailored to her lush surroundings.

Sunni Fighters Returning To Al-Qaida In Iraq , 'NYT ' Reports : The Two-Way After months of being squeezed out by the Iraqi government, Sunni insurgent groups that have fought with and against al-Qaida in Iraq have begun joining forces again to mount attacks. The New York Times, which has reported extensively on the alliance between the Iraqi government and Sunnis fighting the insurgents, notes that the Sunni groups' resurgence could have dire consequences for Iraq. The New York Times reports that Sunni militias that have worked with and against al-Qaida in Iraq are now teaming up to launch attacks against the Iraqi government.

Where will he wake up next? A prison cell? A tropical hammock? Or suspended on a cliff? It has the makings of a pretty good TV show, in the vein of Quantum Leap. Each day, a man wakes up to find himself in a different bed in a different part of the world. The experience, while clearly always disorienting, can vary dramatically based on the circumstances. Some days he’s in prison, or squatting in a storage bin. Other mornings he wakes up in a goat pen or a tropical hammock.

In recent years , platformers have proven to be a hospitable genre for video game developers looking to flaunt their creative and design talents. And this year's Nindies Spring Showcase was no exception. The Nindies showcase was live streamed today at 1 PM PT, and it brought with it a bevy of fresh and exciting platforming games from independent developers, including games like Atooi's 3D Platformer Mega Man 11, the 2.5D adventure game Sable, and the 2.5D platformer Celeste, all of which boast unique styles, gameplay mechanics, and artistic designs in a genre we've seen a bit of a dearth of in recent memory.

Tropical Storm Selma made landfall on the coast of El Salvador on Saturday with strong winds , heavy rains and flooding as it neared the Mexican coast. The storm could develop into a hurricane as it continues to head west towards Mexico where it is expected to weaken and lose some of its power before it makes landfall on the north coast of Mexico. Selma has weakened slightly since it made landfall on the Mexican coast on Tuesday. However, the government continues to urge residents of areas affected by the flooding from Selma to remain on their guard.

There was no shortage of activity taking place on the Grammy stage Sunday night – Motown tributes , Havana reproductions, and a 41-years-and-counting partnership between Stevie and Flea were all honored – but perhaps the most stunning part of the 60th Annual Grammy Awards came in the form of a surprise duet. After a lengthy, 20-minute performance of “A Love Supreme” by Chance the Rapper and The Roots, it was announced that Chance and Kanye would be collaborating on “Waves.” As the beat kicked off, Kanye appeared on stage wearing his “Life of Pablo” glow-in-the-dark t-shirt.

Toronto - A Porter Airlines Dash 8 with 54 on board encountered a UFO at a height of about 9,000ft and 120 knots indicated airspeed. The object was seen to move at incredible speeds and appeared to be changing colours from white to purple and back to white. At 500ft altitude the pilots shut down the autopilot and reduced the aircraft's speed by 10kts. It was noted the aircraft was not pressurised and was not fitted with a pressurisation system, therefore the aircrew could not explain why the aircraft was at 500ft. The UFO was no longer sighted. Further details on this case can be found here.

Veronica Fatia carries her 2-year-old daughter as they travel in a wooden boat to Buzi district , 120 miles outside of the capital, Beira, Mozambique, on Thursday, March 14, 2019, to look for food and shelter after the death of the girl's father and the loss of their home during heavy rain and winds brought on by Tropical Cyclone Idai. Mozambique and Zimbabwe said they were struggling to get aid to people in remote areas after Tropical Cyclone Idai battered Mozambique's coast, unleashed heavy rains in Zimbabwe, and prompted the evacuation of 3,000 villagers in Malawi because of a dam in danger of collapsing.

The thorny question of abortion rights is again taking center stage on Beacon Hill and putting some top officials in the position of explaining and defending their own records on the controversial issue. Gov. Deval Patrick is calling on Republican presidential candidates to answer for past votes against federal funding for family planning services and abortion clinics and for opposing a Supreme Court nominee for her views on the issue. Patrick is also calling for the GOP candidates to explain their support for the state's 1996 buffer zone law. That law requires a 35-foot buffer between abortion clinics and anyone who approaches women approaching the clinic to discuss their options.

Ellen Lucas has been running the Carson Nugget Nevada Day Classic for longer than she cares to remember . The Carson City Classic is the longest continuously running race in Nevada. She has worked hard over the years to give back to the community, which is why she continues to run the race after 22 years and has raised over a million dollars. Ellen is very active in her community. In addition to being involved in many organizations, she has been involved in the Governor's Commission for Women for 22 years and a member of Soroptomists International for over 35 years.

Newly anointed McDonald 's CEO Donald Thompson gets some perks with his fries . A Big Mac may only cost $3.25, but it might as well be $4,500. Thompson and his executive team received $4.5 million in restricted stock options when he was named CEO in January. It is the first option grant Thompson has received in his 5-year-old tenure at the company. McDonald's is the only restaurant operator in the S&P 500 that pays its CEOs in stock. And it is the largest stock-based award ever made to McDonald's executives in the restaurant operator's 30-year history.

Student Senators passed a resolution that would have NYU divest from three companies associated with the Israeli government and institute a moratorium on campus investments. But the Student Senate never actually passed a divestment resolution, and NYU administration immediately rejected the proposal. The resolution was introduced on Monday by student senator Jillian Chase and passed by senators on Tuesday, despite an absence of discussion on the bill in the senate chamber. “The senate has the ability to pass legislation. It’s a very formal process,” said Student Affairs Vice President and Dean of Students Katherine Farris.

ANTIOCH 6/5/16 – When Trevor Dunning first entered the Trinity Christian School speech class, he was personally greeted, as each student was, and a few words of welcome were exchanged. He stood out with his solid physique, and soft intense face. However, the moment he spoke, his struggles became obvious. While talking, he would suddenly push out a breathy deep, "UHH...UHH," which came every three of four words. It was a severe stutter problem. He had enrolled in my speech class to hopefully be able to speak better.

Running errands on your bicycle is a great way to burn calories and get some exercise. When you need something small or you are just checking prices and availability, pedaling to the store can be a pleasant experience if you can find a bicycle-friendly route. Several major shopping locations in the Rogue Valley can be accessed by bicycles without encountering excessive traffic. For example, both the Rogue Valley Mall and the Medford Shopping Center are easily accessible from the Bear Creek Greenway bicycle path. It is somewhat more difficult to ride a bike to the big-box stores along Highway 62 (Crater Lake Highway).

MASSENA – Mr. William V. Cameron, Jr., 62, a resident of Olympia, Washington and a 1977 graduate of Massena Central School, passed away August 31, 2018 in Olympia after a brief illness. William is survived by his daughters, Tina and Josh Rozner of Fulton and Natasha Soucy of Rochester; five grandchildren; his sisters, Ann Cameron of Kissimmee, Florida, Mary Martin, and Patricia and Judy Cameron, all of Massena; his brother, Michael Cameron of Norfolk; and aunts, uncles, nieces, nephews and cousins.

MANILA , Philippines — House Majority Leader Rolando Andaya Jr. will yield his position to Capiz 2nd District Rep. Fredenil Castro after his nomination for the speakership and majority leader posts. Andaya said Thursday, December 27, that Castro's nomination was confirmed by his party-mates and he would no longer be Majority Leader once his term ends on the 18th Congress. Castro's nomination was confirmed with a consensus by his colleagues in the 1st minority bloc in Congress, which includes former Speaker Pantaleon Alvarez, who resigned last September following allegations of vote-selling during the last elections.

WASHINGTON , April 12 , 2019 /PRNewswire/ -- Aries Security 's Capture The Packet ( CTP ) was selected as a Red Herring Global 100 award winner at the North American 2019 event, held in Los Angeles on April 2. Aries Security was selected as one of the 2019 Red Herring 100 winners from a pool of hundreds of candidates from across the globe . Its Capture The Packet ( CT P ) technology enables high-performance network security through a unique combination of application and threat visibility with real-time detection and response. This combination enables organizations to understand and react to modern threats faster than ever.

The Scimitar-horned Oryx no longer lives in the African desert. It is considered extinct in the wild. But this lovely-looking Ungulate hasn’t been completely wiped out because they can still be found at zoos around the world. It’s just one example of a new role that zoos have taken on: preserving endangered wildlife. The U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service lists 361 endangered mammals worldwide. Add in birds, fish, reptiles and other living creatures, that number rises to nearly 1200. That’s why the work of organizations like the Smithsonian Conservation Biology Institute – or SCBI – is so crucial.

Selkirk Avenue was closed down for several hours by a fire . At around 10 a.m. Monday , Winnipeg Fire Paramedic Service received a call of a building on fire in the 100 block of Selkirk . Fire crews arrived within minutes and found a single-storey home on fire, and were able to knock it down quickly, but not without some smoke spreading. The Red Cross is also assisting three families whose homes burned yesterday, including two children, ages 4 and 10, and a 55-year-old man. A total of 16 people had to be displaced due to the fires.

Although the black and orange color combo could have looked a little Halloween, the subtle accessory was just enough to add a zing without looking too costumey. See the singer's leggy LBD look in the photos below! Jordin looks so fierce!

OAKLAND — Nine people living in East Oakland discovered over the past nine months what it”s like to be a journalist — taking on the challenge of telling important but unheard stories from the community around them. Saturday, those nine budding journalists graduated from the Oakland Voices nonprofit program, which helped give them the tools to gather and report those stories. Oakland Voices is a project founded by Oakland Tribune senior community engagement editor Martin Reynolds and coordinated by veteran journalist Brenda Payton. By enlisting people from Oakland”s neighborhoods to tell Oakland stories, the project unravels tales of tragedy and triumph that are not covered by mainstream media.

(MOBL) on Thursday reported a loss of $21 million in its first quarter. On a per-share basis, the Mountain View, California-based company said it had a loss of 27 cents.

EVE Online’s new “Abyssal Deadspace” areas let players engage in true one-on-one combat for big rewards. Just pray you don’t run into BoRn2ReIgN. Abyssal Deadspace pockets, introduced in the latest EVE expansion Onslaught, are a new way for players to engage in high-stakes combat. At the end of the hazard-filled Abyssal Deadspace pockets, new stargates beckon players into Abyssal arenas. In the heart of these arenas, rare and valuable loot is held in a secure container. The only thing stopping a player from scooping it into their cargohold and making a clean escape is another player angling for the same target.

Video — 1 videodisc ( 140 min . ) : sd. , col. ; 4 3/4 in . A dramatisation of the infamous kidnapping, murder and dismemberment by the West Memphis 3 of three young boys, and the controversial trial that followed. Summary: In 1993, three children were brutally murdered in the small Arkansas town of West Memphis. The senseless act sent the quiet, rural community into a tailspin. Three teens were quickly arrested and tried: two of them for capital murder. Three years later and after spending nearly 10 years on Death Row, the convictions of Jason Baldwin and Jessie Misskelley were overturned.

Richard Drew/Associated PressThe normally busy trading floor will be empty on Monday . All United States stock and options markets, including the Nasdaq , will be closed on Monday as the nation mourns the victims of Sunday’s shooting at a South Carolina church. The New York Stock Exchange will also be closed. Even as traders and analysts prepared for Monday’s market closure , they were assessing the impact the shooting will have on financial markets. As the market prepares to close on Monday and trading reopens, investors are expected to remain jittery.

Paul Scruggs had a career-high 24 points, Tyrique Jones added a career-high 20 rebounds and tied his career high with 19 points and the Musketeers held off Evansville 91-85 on Saturday. The 6-foot-11 Hankins and 6-9 Scruggs dominated inside against an Evansville team that didn’t put a player taller than 6-7 on the court. The Musketeers had a whopping 51-22 advantage on the boards. The Musketeers finished with 19 offensive rebounds, matching the Purple Aces’ defensive rebounds and leading to advantages of 44-18 in points in the paint and 15-0 in fast break points.

HARRY REDKNAPP went to Madrid to scout goal thief Diego Forlan on Thursday night but ended up being mugged himself. He was targeted by pickpockets outside the Vicente Calderon stadium before the game where he intended watching Atletico Madrid striker Forlan and Real midfielder Lassana Diarra – who did not play. Redknapp, who lost several hundred pounds of cash and credit cards, said: “Forlan’s a good, interesting player. But it was difficult to concentrate on the game, because I got mugged, had my pockets picked, before the game. It was strange, weird.

COLOGNE CATHEDRAL SWITCHED off its light last night , in protest at the weekly anti-Islam rallies happening in Dresden . Some 100 protesters gathered outside the cathedral, and 10,000 people in the city held placards saying “No to Nazis in our city”. The organisers of the Dresden demonstrations say they are protesting about the German state’s failure to protect the nation’s Christian roots. A spokesman said: “We’re in a situation where in the German state it is illegal to teach about Christian roots in history lessons but illegal to not talk about Islam as well.

Capital abundance , low interest rates , and high volatility are creating new challenges and opportunities in equity markets . How can investors navigate these shifting market conditions and position themselves to benefit from the opportunities that this environment presents? The equity markets have experienced significant volatility and the economic backdrop has changed in the past few months as a result of the Fed’s shift to a more dovish interest-rate policy. In addition, a trade war is simmering, the U.K. is leaving the European Union, and political uncertainty in Italy is creating challenges for the European Union and eurozone.

The casino chain 's stock moved higher as the company announced new expansion plans . A rendering of Paradise Park, Las Vegas, a $1.8 billion redevelopment of the site of the former New Frontier hotel and casino. Caesars Interactive Entertainment, the largest interactive gaming company with 39 casino properties around the U.S., reported second-quarter revenue up 17% to $590.6 million. Net income rose 22.6% to $68.2 million as revenue increased across all three of its businesses: real-money online gaming, social casino games and online horse racing.

The Frewsburg Central School board of education received an update Thursday on the capital project that began last spring . Board members met with Superintendent Matthew J. Gifford to discuss the project, and were given a construction timeline. A preliminary design and project cost analysis is in process and is anticipated to be presented to the board in late October, said Gifford. Funding sources have been determined as $12,382,000 State funds; $2,422,000 Federal Grant; $2,550,000 local capital reserve; $9,300,000 local capital reserve; and $200,000 local capital reserve reimbursement from Chautauqua County.

Unum Therapeutics Inc. is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company . The Company is focused on the developing and commercializing of novel immune cell therapy to treat cancer and autoimmune disorders. UNUM Therapeutics Inc. is focused on the development and commercializing of immunotherapies targeting cancer and autoimmune diseases and is developing products based on its proprietary Universal CARs technology platform. Its lead program targets a number of different cancers. Its Universal CAR technology platform allows for rapid development of cell therapies, as a single therapeutic product targeting a range of tumor types. It is developing UNC009, which is designed to target T-cells to kill tumor cells, including melanoma.

Kids and computers can be a beautiful mix or a disaster waiting to happen . Education-based applications and popular games can encourage children to learn. But without proper supervision, children run the risk of being exposed to violent content, unmonitored chats and inappropriate websites. Parents and teachers are well aware of the dangers and potential benefits of computers in education, entertainment and communications. That is why, in today's age of technology, there's a need for a system to monitor computer activities to ensure that what is being done on your computer is beneficial to children, safe, and not exposing them to something harmful or dangerous.

The NSA spied on Israel despite a US pledge to curtail surveillance of ally states, revealing how the Israelis lobbied US lawmakers to reject the Iranian nuclear deal. The snooping also reportedly eavesdropped on some members of Congress’ private talks. According to the Wall Street Journal, the spying has been ongoing during President Barack Obama’s two terms and continued unabated even after Edward Snowden’s surveillance revelations in 2013. Following the scandal, the Obama administration composed a so-called protected list, shielding close allies from surveillance, including countries such as Germany or France.

SUNRISE , Fla. -- The New York Rangers were n't necessarily impressed with their performance Wednesday night , but they did take care of business, beating the Florida Panthers in regulation, 2-1, on the strength of Henrik Lundqvist's 50th career shutout . New York snapped a three-game losing streak with the win, a much-needed victory heading into the second half of its season , which begins Saturday against the Boston Bruins. Lundqvist stopped all 32 shots he faced, including all 25 he faced in the first two periods, and 15 in the third, as the Rangers improved to 23-15-5 with their second straight home victory over Florida.

Fast bowler Matt Hobden has been tipped for a bright future as he bids to bounce back from one of the worst seasons of his career. A spokesman for the England Under-19 World Cup squad, which has been training at Trent Bridge in Nottingham ahead of this month's event, said: "Matt is one of the quickest bowlers on the tour and one who has been in good form in the lead-up to the tournament." But Hobden's form has suffered badly this summer as he's been forced to fight his way back from an ankle injury.

Rural : Friday is the final day of the 2019 Sungold Field Days event held behind Cheeseworld in Allansford . It is one of the biggest annual agricultural trade shows in Australia. It has been held on the first weekend of October every year since 1962 and is attended by around 55,000 visitors each year. The event attracts more than 300 exhibiters from around Australia and overseas and has more than 500 trade exhibits on display and around 200 static displays. The trade exhibits include all facets of farming from machinery to grains and fertilisers, seed, animal health, haymaking, ploughing and harvesting.

STARSPORT brings you the latest transfer news and gossip from Upton Park . West Ham have had a club-record £31m bid for Celta Vigo striker Ikechi Anya turned down, according to reports. West Ham United are trying to bolster their forward ranks, but Celta have said they would not be prepared to let the Ghana international leave the club in January, reports The Daily Mail. The Daily Mail claim the Hammers' first approach for the 21-year-old was turned down last month, but that they have tabled another £22m for the striker. It is thought that Anya's £10,000-a-week contract is making him an attractive proposition for the Premier League.

EXCLUSIVE : Jacqueline Piñol has booked a recurring role on Amazon ’ s drama series Bosch . She will play Detective Karen Truss , a member of the SIS detective team assigned to the robbery case in the pilot episode. The 4th season is set to begin production later this month , which will be available exclusively on Amazon Prime Video next year . Piñol comes from an acting family, as both parents were performers and her siblings pursued theater in their youths. This led her to study the arts as a child and she continued to pursue acting professionally.

Amazon.com's purchase of Austin-based Whole Foods Market is showing up in the wine category. As this year ends, Amazon has shut down Wine.Woot and its own wine marketplace in favor of Whole Foods' expansive wine operation. Now that Amazon owns Whole Foods, a licensed seller of wine, it comes under different state laws and can't sell directly from a producer. As a result, Dallas entrepreneur Matt Rutledge sees an opening in the marketplace. When Amazon.com purchased daily deals site Woot.com, based in Carrollton, in 2010 it also acquired Wine.Woot, a direct producer-to-consumer website that Amazon adopted for its own wine marketplace.

The Dallas-Fort Worth Film Critics Association , of which this reporter is a member , has named Moonlight as the best film of 2016. It also won for best actor ( Casey Affleck for Manchester by the Sea ) and best director ( Kenneth Lonergan for Manchester ). The organization's members also named Arrival as the best movie in 2016, which makes me wonder if that's the movie they really want to be remembered for, because Manchester by the Sea, also a very good movie, is one of the year's best.

The storm we're bracing for is the type of January variety everyone prepares for: monitor school closings, check flashlights and stock up on bread, eggs and milk. It's hard to know exactly how any storm will hit until it actually arrives. But there's a foreboding sense about what to expect in the coming days. "We had something comparable in January 2014," said Aaron Reynolds, meteorologist at the National Weather Service in Buffalo. That storm launched Buffalo's first official blizzard in 21 years at the time.

An injury at work left a husband and father facing a layoff. He couldn't return to the job until his hand healed from surgery, but recovery was complicated by an ongoing struggle with diabetes. With two children in the home, the family saved enough to pay the power bill. Unfortunately, that left very little money for rent. The Clarke County School District contacted the Empty Stocking Fund for help on the family's behalf. A check was written for a portion of the rent in an effort to keep the family in their home.

After delivering a blockbuster such as Meri Gurriya , writer Radain Shah is on a roll as her story explores women's issues, this time through the prism of an arranged marriage with a 37- year-old man. "But, as a writer, I can never say 'No' to any challenge. I love writing about different subjects and here I have managed to do it through a love story.

A 29-year-old woman was killed when her car was hit by a train on a crossing in Ogi , Saga prefecture, Saga Prefectural Police said. According to police, the woman, who works at a beauty spa, was driving a Honda Legend sedan toward Saga Station around 12:30 a.m., when she apparently turned on the crossing signal, then drove into the train path, and was hit by a southbound 5:15 a.m. express train between Saga and Imari. Ogi police and Saga Prefectural Fire and Dispatch officials arrived at the accident scene a few minutes later and confirmed her death.

A new study for The New York Times reveals that the media pay for the top 200 CEOs is now $14.5 million. This is up 55 in the last year. While any one CEO may be well worth his/her raise, it is a growing political and PR problem for corporate America to be seen as rewarding those at the top, with little consideration for actual performance. For millions of Americans who are unemployed, under employed and being foreclosed on, it seems inconceivable that corporate CEOs can be getting significant raises at a time of such economic hardship.

Can You Keep a Secret ? is based on Sophie Kinsella ’ s 4-million-copy New York Times bestseller and centers on a young woman who finds herself in the middle of a love triangle that will change her life forever…
Katie is the type of girl who likes to stay busy. Been there, done that, no regrets. But the one thing on her mind lately is the fact that she is in love with Josh, and she has been since they were in middle school. But, Katie’s not one to take action, and she has kept her feelings under wraps for years.

With the economic noose poised to tighten around Iran over its suspect nuclear program, the Tehran regime is shaking a stick at Gulf nations. Tensions in the Persian Gulf and modest economic recovery in the United States could influence retail gasoline prices, analysts said. The International Energy Agency could respond to a major Middle East oil crisis but doesn't see any immediate need for action, the group's director said. Military officials in Tehran said the United States can not stop Iran from preventing oil from passing through the strategic Strait of Hormuz.

Shares in Premier Foods shot up five per cent earlier today after the Mr Kipling and Hovis group said it had received a new takeover approach from US food giant Kraft, worth 170p per share in cash. This compares with Kraft's last approach of 161.5p made in March and values the group, which owns brands including Bisto, Hartley's, Bisto and Oxo at £523 million. Previous bids for the firm were rejected by chairman John Bason, who argued that a bid below 195p was too low, and the group would not sell for less than 200p.

Although state trademark registration offers fewer benefits than trademark registration with the United States Patent and Trademark Office, state trademark registration can be a cheap alternative for securing limited trademark rights. Federal trademark registration can run anywhere from several hundred dollars to $3,000, depending on the type of mark being registered and the amount of attorney's fees. On the other hand, many states charge less than $100 to file a trademark application. Keep in mind that state registration will not offer multi-state protection, nationwide priority status, incontestability, a presumption of validity or the ability to file a trademark on an intent to use basis.

The ease of Manchester United’s win over Premier League title rivals Chelsea masked a potential moment of controversy after an “innovative” corner routine involving Wayne Rooney, Ryan Giggs and Cristiano Ronaldo produced a goal, with the scores still level, that was disallowed under instruction from the linesman. Step Two: Ryan Giggs picks up the loose ball following Rooney's hand-over. United manager Sir Alex Ferguson expressed astonishment that the effort, converted by Ronaldo, did not stand, admitting the routine had been planned on the training ground. Step one: Wayne Rooney goes over to corner flag to take quick set-piece.

In a study from 24/7 Wall Street , Leelanau County was named Michigan 's most expensive housing market with a median home price of $298,000. In 2015 the U.P.’s housing market was on the rise. There were many new home construction projects. Many homes were sold. With the rising housing market, home prices will continue to go up. The median home price in the Upper Peninsula rose 7.5 percent in 2015. The median home price in the U.P. is about $100,000 cheaper than in the rest of Michigan, according to an analysis of Zillow home value data by Trulia .

Harvest season is back , which means it ’ s time to drive out to the farm stands on the North Shore and pick some of the tastiest produce from our neighboring farmers. If you ’ re not familiar with farm stands, they are local markets where you can buy fresh, farm-to-market goods directly from the farmers who grow them. Farm stands are also great places to get fresh-pressed apple cider, as well as pumpkins, squash and other fall vegetables. If you ’ re not able to get to the farms, don ’ t worry.

In Syria, Peace Plan 'Is Unraveling' : The Two-Way "It's almost as if in certain parts of the country the ceasefire isn't in effect anymore," NPR's Kelly McEvers reports. Syrian refugee children looked out of a bus last week after they arrived at a camp in Turkey. The U.N.-brokered plan to stop the killing in Syria "is unraveling," as guest host Lynn Neary said earlier on Morning Edition. Lynn spoke with NPR's Kelly McEvers, who is monitoring the situation in Syria from Beirut. Kelly said that in some places "shelling by Syrian military troops continues unabated."

Newly anointed McDonald's CEO Donald Thompson gets some perks with his fries. A Big Mac may only cost a few dollars at McDonald’s, but when it comes to the fast food chain’s Big Mac Special Sauce, things get pricey fast. McDonald’s Australia has apparently decided to auction off the first of 200 bottles of their “legendary” sauce on eBay and bidders are emptying more than just their pockets for a chance to purchase the limited-edition bottle. Doing business in British Columbia is particularly challenging because of the province ’ s reputation as a hotbed of environmental activism. Environmental groups regularly challenge environmental decisions made by the provincial government and its agencies, including in B.C. Supreme Court. While there is no guarantee of winning an environmental litigation case, when the B.C. government does win, it tends to be in high-profile cases that have a substantial effect on the environmental landscape in British Columbia. In such cases, there can be a considerable amount of “spin” from all quarters about the case and the government’s win.

Tim Hortons and an association representing some of its frustrated franchisees are close to reaching a settlement in two class-action lawsuits the group filed against the coffee-and-doughnut chain. Tim Hortons and the Great White North Franchisee Association submitted a term sheet signed by their respective legal counsel to justice Edward Morgan at the Ontario Superior Court of Justice Wednesday. “I think both parties, we’ve worked really hard to reach this point and I think that it’s going to be positive for the Tim Hortons brand moving forward and for our guests and for Tim Horton franchisees,” said Mark Walker, the GWNFA’s president.

WATCH : Sunday marked the third anniversary of B.C . declaring a public health emergency because of the overdose crisis. Heroin and other opioid drugs killed 724 B.C. residents last year, more than double the number of overdose deaths recorded in 2016, the coroners’ service says. The 931 suspected illicit-drug-related deaths recorded in 2018 include 511 from opioid toxicity, an increase of 95 per cent from 2016. The death rate was 36 per cent higher than the number of deaths from motor vehicle incidents in 2018, the service noted in its report.

One person died and 8,469 people were affected in torrential rains that prevails in Galle from Saturday evening, Galle Additional District Secretary M.M.M Sharfaz said. Over 8,469 people in Baddegama, Yakkalmulla, Imaduwa, Thawalama, Niyagama, Nagoda, Habaraduwa and Akmeemana were adversely affected, he said. The Galle Disaster Management Center Head said the deceased was identified as a father of four (60), a resident of Urala in Wanduramba. He had drowned in flood and his body was found yesterday evening, he said. He said five houses were completely destructed, and 244 were partly damaged.

Judy Watson watched as the California Poppy Reserve was established in the 1970s just five miles from her home . . . and was inspired. She began collecting seeds from the wildflowers and other plants that grew there, and she and other friends started a garden club. Judy’s garden is now known as the Watson Garden, and is home to hundreds of California native plants. It’s located just west of the town of Idyllwild, California, which is located 8,000 feet above sea level. The town was originally populated by the Cahuilla indians who settled there in 1500.

Pliskova pulls out of Czech team for Fed Cup final vs. U.S. PRAGUE ( Reuters ) - World number eight Karolina Pliskova withdrew from the Czech Republic's team for next week's Fed Cup final against defending champions United States, the Czech team said on Tuesday. "We have been in touch with Pliskova for a week, we are trying to make her feel better but the situation isn't changing,'' captain Petr Pala said in a team statement on their website (www.czechteam.org). "But it was her wish that we would go ahead with other players.

House Republicans weren ’ t talking about the economy as they left Washington for the August recess before a challenging vote on a $ 447 billion bill to provide funding to a broad range of programs through the next fiscal year beginning Oct. 1, 2011. Instead, the legislators made a final run of speeches on the floor of the House about repealing the 2010 law known as the health care reform bill that passed Congress and was signed into law by President Barack Obama last year. The bill passed on a strictly party-line vote and will go to Obama when Congress reconvenes.

GRAND RAPIDS , Mich. — Democrat John Edwards endorsed former rival Barack Obama on Wednesday , a move designed to give Obama a boost in Michigan and other upcoming Super Tuesday states and help put to rest a primary season that has gone on too long. The move by Edwards came as Obama was campaigning in the state on Wednesday and as the New York senator was on the campaign trail in North Carolina, the state where he was born and spent part of his boyhood. The Edwards endorsement could also prove a significant boost for Edwards , who has seen his own presidential campaign flounder after a strong showing earlier in the primaries.

BAMAKO , Mali – The head of an ethnic Dogon militia blamed for a massacre in central Mali is denying responsibility for the violence. In a phone call with The Associated Press, leader Ousmane Dano Toure said the Dogon militia did not commit the killings at the village of Sobane Da. The militia leader said he had no contact with the ethnic Fulani people who he said were suspected of the massacre that killed 157 people in Mali last week. Dano Toure’s comments were confirmed by a Malian official. Dano Toure, who is in the southern Mopti region of central Mali, said his group was not responsible.

The eight-episode 1980s-set drama will air in the summer. Mere weeks after finishing production on the pilot and securing a series order, the cast and creators of Ryan Murphy's newest FX drama, Pose, met reporters Friday at the Television Critics Association's winter press tour where they touted the realness of the drama that explores the ball culture. Pose looks at the juxtaposition of several segments of life and society in 1980s New York: the rise of the luxury Trump-era universe, the downtown social and literary scene, and the ball culture world.

Why do we only hear about Jasper Johns when he gets ripped off? Jasper Johns is the greatest artist alive. It seems a shame that he only enters the headlines when people rip him off. Johns was in court this week to give evidence against a Queens, New York foundry owner, Brian Ramnarine, who has now pleaded guilty to faking one of the artist's works. It was a bronze version of one of the most iconic of all American paintings: Flag. Johns had made four bronze copies of Flag in 1960 at Ramnarine's foundry.

When I opened the brown clasp envelope and pulled out the 21-page spiral book , I was startled . Dr. Mills had not only given me my medical file, he had also taken the time to add his handwritten comments and notes. This book was not a transcription of his medical file, this was my file. This man had not merely looked up a name and a record number in the computer. He took the time to go through the file and write his thoughts in his own hand on the page, noting his personal interactions with me.

U.S. President Donald Trump attends a swearing in ceremony for senior staff at the White House in Washington, DC January 22, 2017. BEIJING (Reuters) - The new U.S. administration must fully understand the importance of the "one China" policy and appreciate that the issue of Taiwan is highly sensitive for the Beijing government, China said on Monday. Although state trademark registration offers fewer benefits than trademark registration with the United States Patent and Trademark Office , state trademark registration has its advantages in that it is generally less expensive and easier than the federal application process. State Trademark Registration, in the United States, is generally governed by each individual states statutes. Each state is different with regards to how a mark should be applied to gain trademark status. The general concept of state trademark registration is that the mark must be used in commerce to acquire a state trademark filing. The trademark must be used or there will not be trademark registration.

An Austrian man has nearly burned down his home in an attempt to get rid of a mouse. The man found a mouse hole in his newly renovated house in Austria. In order to rid of the unwanted guest, the man filled the wall with flammable polyurethane foam. According to news website ORF.at, when the home owner started to pulverize the foam, it caught fire from a candle. As a result, an entire wall of the house started to burn, leading to a massive fire. It took 32 firefighters to extinguish the blaze.

Ryanair has lowered its full year profit guidance from a current range of €1.25-€1.35 billion to a new range of €1.10-€1.20 billion. The decision, which saw shares in the airline fall by more than ten per cent, comes after a turbulent period for the low-cost carrier. The Irish airline was recently hit by a fall in traffic after pilots and cabin crew in Germany, Holland, Belgium, Spain and Portugal went on strike. Ryanair has also been forced to lower fares for the third quarter of the year (particularly for the October school half-term holidays and Christmas) as customer confidence has been affected by fear of further strikes.

Considering all the comings and goings of people involved in the project , we should be grateful that Bohemian Rhapsody has finally seen the light of day . We should also give the cast and crew all the credit they’re due for making this film look as authentic as it did. Rami Malek as Freddie Mercury. The film tells the story of the formation, the meteoric rise and the solo career of Queen through the lens of its lead singer Freddie Mercury. We are also introduced to his relationships with the band members, his bandmates, and other individuals who influenced his music such as Paul Prenter.

Millions of refugees have fled their homes in war-torn Syria since 2011 . President Barack Obama previously planned to resettle 10,000 over the next year. But following the massive terror attacks in Paris over the weekend where at least 129 died, many governors and legislators — mostly Republicans — have called for Obama to rethink the resettlement strategy. Delaware is one of at least nine states to openly welcome the idea of refugees, despite an avalanche of largely Republican governors opposing. According to a count by Vox , 25 governors have said they would bar admission of Syrian refugees to their states and 15 governors said they still support resettlement in their states.

Beating the Patriots in the Super Bowl is never easy. When they scored 21 points the first three times they held the ball in the second half and took a 33-32 lead, we all thought the same scary movie we’ve seen since 2001 was replaying before our eyes. But this epic brought a different ending. This one saw Foles, a man of faith who wants to be a pastor when he leaves the game, play as if touched by God. He completed 28 of 43 passes for 373 yards with three touchdowns and an interception.

BAGHDAD -- The Iraqi government launched an investigation yesterday into the apparent torture of detainees in a secret Interior Ministry detention facility, and parliamentarians summoned the minister to answer for the abuse. The allegations were based on a video that shows prisoners chained, bloody and apparently beaten in a darkened, underground cell. The men are identified as Sunnis, including a man with a broken leg, and are accused of working with insurgents. "These are real Iraqis. They have families," said the man speaking in the video, which was obtained by The Washington Post.

German chancellor Angela Merkel prepares to press the start bottom next to the head of the Max Planck Institute for Plasma Physics Sibylle Guenter , left, and Mecklenburg-Western Pomerania governor, Erwin Sellering, right at the Wendelstein 7-X' nuclear fusion research center at the Max-Planck-Institut for Plasma Physics in Greifswald, Germany Wednesday Feb. 3, 2016. The pheasant-hunting season in New York is under way , and thanks to a great stocking program hunters should find birds plentiful all across the Adirondack Park and beyond. The pheasant is the only species of wild game that can be hunted during the spring and summer in the state. This year, a limited number of wild pheasant hunts are also available. The New York Department of Environmental Conservation will host a pheasant-hunting clinic and hunt for youths on June 23 at the DEC Windsor Pond Wildlife Management Area in the Town of Windsor (Warren County).

The U.S. government is charging that Google is systematically paying women less than their male counterparts . Testifying in a federal class action lawsuit, a former employee alleged that “pay disparity was a huge problem” at the Internet giant, and that women are paid less “at all levels of the company, even when controlling for job performance.” A 2008 study conducted by the University of California at Berkeley found that the median weekly earnings of male Google engineers were 11.7 percent higher than that of their female counterparts. That study also revealed that Google had the highest salary difference between men and women in the industry.

This week, in a closed-door meeting of Congressional Democrats with President Obama, Representative Ed Perlmutter of Colorado bluntly said what has been on many politicians' minds: "Larry Summers. Bad choice." Mr. Obama was visibly annoyed and mounted a defense of Mr. Summers, his former economic policy adviser who also served as Treasury secretary under President Bill Clinton. Mr. Summers, who the president said had become something of a "progressive whipping boy," appears to be a strong contender to succeed Ben S. Bernanke as chairman of the Federal Reserve.

A violent thug has been jailed after he unleashed his American pitbull dog on a man who died six days later from horrific injuries including a broken neck. Kyle Tyson, 18, was jailed for 20 months after he used the dog named Scooby to cause a huge gash to the top of a 53-year-old man's head which then caused a brain hemorrhage. Tyson has already been sent to prison three times as a youth for violence and has been banned from keeping animals for 10 years. However, the court heard the dog's injuries were so severe they may have been caused by the dog having been used as a baton.

In a story April 30 about MobiIeIron Inc. & apos ; s earnings , The Associated Press reported that the company received about $13 million in federal loans under the U.S. The story should have said the amount of the company's federal loan was $13.3 million, according to a company spokeswoman, and that federal officials expect the company to repay the loans in full over time. The story also should have made clear that the company had applied for a $40 million federal loan that was expected to be approved last year but wasn't due to delays in the government's approval process.

What 's the difference between bipolar I and bipolar II ? Bipolar disorder is a mental health condition that causes extreme shifts in mood. In bipolar I, these shifts or "mood swings" last at least 7 days and you also have at least one manic episode -- a period of unusual energy, racing thoughts, and unusual behavior. In bipolar II, your mood shifts aren't as severe but you also have episodes of depression. But not everyone with bipolar disorder has both types of mood shifts. Bipolar I is also sometimes called "manic-depressive disorder."

The thorny question of abortion rights is again taking center stage on Beacon Hill and putting some top officials in an uncomfortable spot, chief among them Gov. Charlie Baker. This week Baker, a Republican who supports abortion rights, celebrated the signing of a bill approving $8 million to offset the potential loss of federal funding to women's reproductive health organizations under a new Trump administration rule. That rule, dubbed a "gag rule" by critics, would prohibit federally funded family planning clinics from making abortion referrals or sharing office space with abortion providers.

The Geo Quiz has an American culinary twist this time . The city we want you to name was named for a food in 1848. It's the only one of the original 11 California cities with a Hispanic name to have a name derived from the English-language word for a popular dish . Name that city and win a prize. The Quiz is about a city that was named for a popular Spanish-language word. The Geo Quiz is all about a city that's just across the border from the United States . It's known for its proximity to Mexico and its large Hispanic population.

BAMAKO, Mali – The head of an ethnic Dogon militia blamed for a massacre in central Mali is denying that his fighters were involved in the gruesome attack. Youssouf Toloba also dismissed the Malian president's vow to eliminate the group, because "he isn't the one who created it." Human Rights Watch has said that Toloba's ethnic militia known as Dan Na Ambassagou has been implicated in scores of attacks in recent months. Suspicion immediately fell on the group when at least 134 people were slain over the weekend in an ethnic Peulh village.

I'm told he's an interesting person. And he knows how to tell a good anecdote. But, at the risk of oversimplifying my critique of his work ... he oversimplifies.

The Phoenix Coyotes are still for sale and there are many suitors for the franchise. The owners are working with bankruptcy court to determine the sale of the team so they can get out of a financial debt owed to a former owner. The Coyotes will play the next season in the Phoenix suburbs at Jobing.com Arena, while a temporary solution for where the team will play is sought. So, what does the city and the fans have to do ?

May 23 - Egyptians arrive early at voting booth to cast their vote for the first president since deposed leader Hosni Mubarak. Rough cut (no reporter narration). ROUGH CUT, NO REPORTER NARRATION Security tightens around Cairo, as Egyptians gather to vote for their president. This will be the first time they are picking their president. The election is wide open, pitting Islamists against men who served under deposed leader Hosni Mubarak. The contest is a novelty for a nation where elections during the 30-year rule of a man some called "Pharaoh" were thinly attended rigmaroles in which the result was a foregone conclusion.

Bavarian farmers are angry that their famous Alpine dairy cows will apparently have to wear nappies under European Union environmental laws. Johann Huber, whose family has farmed on the mountain slopes of Gmund am Tegernsee for over 400 years, has begun putting home made nappies on his 18 diary cows to avoid falling foul of an EU fertiliser ban. Mr Huber said that his cow Doris had behaved well when he fitted her with a home made bovine nappy to prevent her dropping cow pats on the Alpine slopes. "We have no standard nappies, they have not been developed commercially yet," he said.

ORANGEBURG, S.C. — Talk-show host and media mogul Oprah Winfrey has conducted a jailhouse interview with a South Carolina mother who pleaded guilty to killing her two sons. Winfrey went to the jail in Orangeburg last week where 30-year-old Shaquan Duley is awaiting sentencing. Winfrey interviewed Duley’s family in September 2010, a month after Duley suffocated her 2-year-old and 18-month-old sons, then tried to stage their deaths by driving her car into a river. Prosecutors say she killed the children after being badgered by her mother about being a poor parent. Duley faces 30 years to life in prison when she’s sentenced Friday.

If you would like to support the Down Syndrome Association of West Michigan's campaign of kindness, you may visit the organization's crowd funding site to help pay for supplies. The more money raised, the more random acts of kindness those in our community with Down syndrome will be able to commit. The Down Syndrome Association of West Michigan is a resource and advocacy organization promoting public awareness and supporting lifelong opportunities for individuals with Down syndrome and their families. Down syndrome is the most commonly occurring chromosomal condition, with one in every 700 babies being born with Down syndrome.

CINCINNATI -- As FC Cincinnati fans chanted and cheered for taxpayers to help fund a Major League Soccer stadium, Hamilton County leaders laid out a bleak reality: The county has too many projects and no way to pay for them all. From an outdated convention center to the obsolete Western Hills Viaduct, Hamilton County Commissioners are trying to figure out how to pay for more than $1.5 billion worth of infrastructure, development, transportation and county building needs in the coming years. "We have more projects than we have money," Hamilton County Commission President Todd Portune told a crowd of at least 150 people Tuesday night.

Now is the right time to prepare for the bushfire season in Tasmania . Prepare your property and make a plan. Tasmania is the only Australian state that has a specific Bushfire Prone Area (BPA) which identifies areas on private and crown land within 10 kilometres of the coast and an area inland from this 10km band. The BPA was created in 1996 after the tragic Black Saturday fires that claimed 413 lives in Victoria. It has been developed for all land users in bushfire prone land, including private and public landholders, to identify areas that may be subject to potential bushfire threats.

Carton House : The 668-acre mansion , hotel and golf and sports facilities “ reached consensual agreement with Nama to extend its lease “
Eamonn McEneaney, chief executive of Nama, today said it was a great result for Nama and Ireland. Carton House Golf Club, the 36-hole hotel and sports complex, and the equestrian centre, are being sold in a deal that could bring up to €350m into the hands of its owners. It is one of the biggest commercial property sales ever by a non-bank Irish bank and is a sign that foreign investment into the Irish economy is beginning to return after the collapse of the Irish banking system.

While it’s not the most glamorous construction project, the state Department of Transportation says it’s something that needs fixing. It’s the replacement of old sign supports that hold up those large green signs that direct us at intersections and exits. “The new sign supports are necessary because the old sign supports have reached the end of their life expectancy. HARRISBURG, Pa. (AP) — Pennsylvania State Police say car accidents killed seven people and injured 315 others over the long holiday weekend. From Dec. 21 through Christmas, state police investigated 1,336 crashes. Of those, 108 were alcohol-related. Two of the seven people who died were not wearing seat belts. One fatality stemmed from an alcohol-related accident. Troopers made 348 arrests for driving under the influence and issued 2,152 speeding citations. Crash and casualty numbers are up from 2011, but the holiday weekend was longer this year. In 2011, authorities reported five people died and 169 others were hurt in 509 crashes.

For Bruce Logan, microbes are an electrifying subject. The Kappe professor of environmental engineering at Pennsylvania State University works on creating alternative-fuel cells powered by anaerobic bacteria. "Because these bacteria breathe without oxygen they will transfer electrons from their food outside their bodies to an electrode," he says. Enough bacteria doing this at the same time will generate a current. At just a few millivolts It won't charge a phone, but it's enough to get a reading.
