One 15-year-old girl from Russia loved sharing her image on social media . She would take selfies whenever the mood would strike her, and then post the pictures on Snapchat , VK, and other social media sites. These photos would make their way to the Internet, where they could be seen by thousands of people. MANSEHRA, Nov 27: Provincial Minister for Haj and Auqaf Nimroz Khan on Tuesday said time was not far when Torghar would be fully developed district of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. “People of Torghar remained deprived of basic civic amenities when their area was part of the Mansehra district and they had to travel to other parts of Hazara for meeting needs, but now the health, education and other infrastructure is being set up in the new district which would bring a major change in the life of people,” said Mr Khan while speaking at a public gathering in Nusratkhail, after inaugurating a road project in the area.

For three turbulent centuries, the glimpse of a square sail and dragon-headed prow on the horizon struck terror into the hearts of medieval Europeans. Indeed, the Viking Age, from A.D. 800-1100, was the age of the sleek, speedy longship. Without this crucial advance in ship technology, the Vikings would never have become a dominant force in medieval warfare, politics, and trade. With their invention of the longship, the Vikings spurred a literal sea change in medieval European affairs. The drekar, or dragon-headed longships, were stealthy troop-carriers.

That’s an improvement over 2006, which found that 63 percent of young children saw more men. But the 65 percent stat is still a concern, said Dr. Stacy L. Smith, who is an associate professor in the Annenberg School for Communication and director of the USC’s Media, Diversity & Social Change Initiative, which conducted the research.

Minister for Enterprise and Commerce , Max Bradford , today rejected claims by the Engineers Union that jobs created by a $100 million package of road-building and other works announced earlier this month would disappear in a few years. The University of Arkansas at Fort Smith recently told student Jennifer Braly that she was prohibited from giving lectures about the Holocaust because “it doesn’t serve a greater good for the community.” Braly was preparing to give the lectures in the school’s Jewish studies class when it was canceled by the History department chair, who wrote, “It would not be appropriate for the UA Fort Smith Department of History to host a lecture series about the Holocaust. Promises to replace houses sold off under the Right to Buy scheme look increasingly hollow as the Government slashes council housing budgets by 60 per cent since 2010. The housing minister Brandon Lewis told a housing conference this weekend that the government had provided local authorities with the resources needed to build 130,000 new council homes by 2020 – which works out to building about 3,600 homes a year over six years. In 2013-14, local authorities built just 1,152 new council homes – less than half of that target, and just a fraction of what they built over the previous 15 years.

Tim Hortons and an association representing some of its frustrated franchisees are close to reaching a settlement in two class-action lawsuits, the company announced Wednesday. Ontario franchisees have been fighting Tim Hortons on several legal fronts since June 2015. They claim that the company is abusing its dominance in the quick service breakfast food market by requiring franchisees to adhere to strict terms in the franchise agreements. The agreements require the companies to pay hefty royalties, which many believe are unreasonable, according to a statement from the franchisees. The agreements also require restaurants to use Tim Hortons products like coffee, buns and other food.

There were two dividing impulses in Robin Williams 's performances that could , roughly , be called his American and his international impulses. Both were evident, to varying degrees, in every film and every stage role of his half century of work in show business — except in his last film, " Boulevard ." But they came together in a rare way in "Good Morning, Viet Nam," which opens today. It is the first time that I can think of — the only time in my own lifetime — that a major American star chose to play a major American figure in a leading role.

At least 21 people were killed and hundreds wounded in four days of fighting between two rival tribes in the southeastern city of Baidoa, the government said. Baidoa residents told Al Jazeera on Monday that the violence that erupted on Saturday was continuing, and had not subsided. Most Janus cats don't live for more than a few days, but Frank and Louie's unusually long life earned him a place in the Guinness World Records. December 8, 2014, 10:49 a.m.
Frank and Louie, a ragdoll cat born with two faces, wasn't expected to live more than a few days, but for years he defied the odds. The cat passed away last week at the age of 15. Janus cats, named after the two-faced Roman god, are extremely rare and typically don't live long due to health problems related to their deformity.

Low-income working families are losing hundreds of pounds each year – and being wrongly denied free healthcare entitlements – because of flaws in the way universal credit is designed, campaigners say. The Child Poverty Action Group (CPAG ) said arbitrary rules built in to the way universal credit is calculated leave some families unable to predict how much they will be paid each month, leaving households in debt and unable to budget. It can lead to claimants being wrongly benefit-capped – a penalty designed to “incentivise” jobless or low-earning households by severely limiting their benefits – because the system fails to spot they are working and earning enough.

Fish oil. Protein shakes. Vitamin D pills. The packages look alike. Does it matter which you buy? It certainly does, according to Labdoor, a four-year-old, South San Francisco-based startup that tests about 50 supplements and energy drinks each month that it buys off retail shelves, then ranks for consumers. What it finds might intrigue you. Vitamin C degrades in water, for example, so any water-based Vitamin C tablets are basically worthless. More than a quarter of fish oil products are rancid on the shelves, even when their expiration date may be two years out.

You may remember Gary Coleman, the child actor from the 1970s show "Diff'rent Strokes." Coleman died on May 28, 2010, in Provo, Utah, from an intracranial hemorrhage. After "Diff'rent Strokes" ended its successful eight year run, Coleman sued his parents for misappropriating millions of dollars in his trust fund.

HERTFORD , N.C. — Hertford police say a 10-month-old boy is dead after a dog attacked him while he was in a backyard Sunday night. Investigators believe the boy was in a playpen when a large mixed-breed dog entered through a door that was left open. The dog reportedly bit the boy several times before the owner pulled it away. The dog, which is being quarantined by the Hertford County Animal Control Department, had not been licensed or vaccinated. Authorities say it is not known what type of vaccine was required for the dog.

The NSA spied on Israel despite a US pledge to curtail surveillance of ally states , revealing how the Israelis were targeted even as Obama administration officials insist that Washington has no backdoor spying on friendly countries. New York, NY, March 19, 2014 … In recognition of her “abiding commitment to promoting and protecting human rights at home and abroad,” the Anti-Defamation League (ADL) today presented German Chancellor Angela Merkel with its distinguished ADL Joseph Prize for Human Rights. The prize was presented at the German Chancellery in Berlin by members of a leadership delegation currently traveling in Germany led by Barry Curtiss-Lusher, ADL National Chair and Abraham H. (CNN) — Portuguese sailors called it the "Gates of Hell." Namibia's Bushmen speak of the land God made in anger. From the air, the bleak shoreline of the Skeleton Coast looks wonderful -- a deep green sea, fringed with surf, breaks over a shore receding into infinite dunes. From land, it's a different story. The Benguela Current rushes in, urgent and strong, hurtling the chilling Atlantic into the fierce heat of the Namib. Whale and seal skeletons from the former whaling industry still litter the coastline -- the source of the region's frightening name.

( CNN ) -- Thousands of people in Northern Ireland protested Wednesday against the killing of two soldiers and a policeman by dissident republican group the Real Irish Republican Army (IRA). Crowds estimated at around 4,000 marched through Belfast to protest the killings, which took place Sunday in County Antrim. The marchers carried British flags, and some shouted "Ulster will never forget." Belfast police said about 400 protesters remained at the main rally at Belfast City Hall into the night, with a smaller number still at a makeshift shrine set up at the spot where the three men were murdered.

A jaunt through October 's art highlights . Eighty-eight-year-old Jack McLarty has had a distinguished career , with an exhibition every year for more than four decades . His work includes oil , gouache , ink , pastel and photography . A retrospective of his work is being held at Newcastle Regional Art Gallery, from February 11 until April 3 . His work can also be found in many collections across the world, including the Art Gallery of New South Wales, the Art Gallery of Western Australia, the Art Gallery of South Australia, the Museum of Modern Art in New York, and the National Gallery in London.

The OLCC is cracking down on marijuana retailers that sell to minors . PORTLAND , Ore. – A rule increasing the fines for retailers caught selling to minors recently went into effect, and it's already having a big impact on Oregon's retail stores. Retailers caught violating the law were already fined $500, or three times the cost of each violation, and the OLCC's board of directors decided to make the penalty even more stringent. The maximum fine increased to $5,000 on May 3, and it can reach $7,000 if there were multiple violations within a three-year period prior to the first conviction.

Two capitals are look set to burst through the 40C mark and another swelters through its 10th day of a heatwave. Melbourne is set to hit 42C today, a figure a climate expert has called a once in a decade heat event. Adelaide’s CBD has seen temperatures soar to 41C on Thursday as south eastern Australia sweats its way through 36 hours of “intense heat”. At 2.30pm Adelaide’s CBD reached its forecast high for the day and is likley to keep on climbing. Further inland, Port Augusta touched 44.7C, Ceduna 45.5C and Nullabor 46.2C at 1.40pm.

Maybe it would be best if we recognize that fossil fuels had their role, evolve our power supplies to renewable, storable resources, and stop demonizing everyone.

Truckee running back Tyler Curtis is shown bowling over a Moapa Valley defensive back during the 2012 state championship in Las Vegas. (Jeff Scheid/LVN file photo)
The Truckee Truckers will open their 2016 season with a home game against rival Incline on the newly resurfaced turf field at Surprise Stadium. The 7 p.m. matchup against the Highlanders is part of a six-game home schedule that begins on Aug. 19 against Fernley. The schedule also features matches with Virginia City and Yerington on Sept. 2, Fallon on Oct. 7 and Lowry on Oct. 21.

An extra $190,000 in state special education reimbursement funding that came in late last month has helped the town pay off its nearly half million-dollar settlement with the district's bus drivers union, officials said this week. Together with around $300,000 in savings found in the district's fiscal 2011 budget, the money has covered the town's $497,000 obligation to the drivers, whose jobs have been outsourced to a private busing company. The additional special education money, part of the state's circuit breaker program, will prevent the town from having to carry the debt over into fiscal 2012, officials said.

JERUSALEM — The face-off at the security gate outside the Western Wall one Friday this month was familiar: for more than two decades, women have been making a monthly pilgrimage to pray at one of Judaism’s holiest sites in a manner traditionally preserved for men, and the police have stopped them in the name of maintaining public order. But after a flurry of arrests this fall that set off an international outcry, the women arrived for December’s service to find a new protocol ordered by the ultra-Orthodox rabbi who controls the site.

Paul Scruggs had a career-high 24 points , Tyrique Jones added a career-high 20 rebounds and tied his career high in assists , and Xavier beat Georgetown 76-62 on Sunday night. Georgetown was trying to hold on in the first half despite the absence of two starters. But the Hoyas missed too many of their free throws in the first 12 minutes of the second half, fell behind by 13 and never could get any closer. Jay Heath had 16 points and six assists for Xavier (18-9, 8-6 Big East), which had lost three of its last four games.

Iqbal Survé’s Sagarmatha Technologies, which failed to list on the JSE a year ago, has set its sights on an offshore listing, according to Survé’s newspaper Business Report. Sagarmatha, a technology company within the Sekunjalo investment group, has already made an application to the SA Reserve Bank, the publication said, citing Survé, the chair of Independent Media. In early 2018, Sagarmatha’s listing on the JSE — along with a mooted listing in New York — was scuppered by its failure to submit financial statements on time.

The Giants have several holes to fill heading into the 2019 season , and own the No . 6 overall pick in next week’s draft. They could certainly use a quarterback, but they also have many other needs on offense and defense. General manager Jerry Reese could look to make several picks and free-agent moves to put the Giants back atop the NFC East. In order to get an idea of what the Giants will do with the draft picks and free agency, let’s check in with The Huddle’s mock draft expert Peter Schwartz.

An online portal aimed at ensuring that the Muslim community gets religious knowledge from recognised sources was launched yesterday by the Islamic Religious Council of Singapore (Muis). Besides being able to access articles from accredited religious teachers, users on LearnIslam.sg can also sign up for Islamic education programmes run by mosques and other Islamic education providers. The site, targeted at young adults, was unveiled by Minister-in-charge of Muslim Affairs Yaacob Ibrahim at the Al-Iman Mosque in Bukit Panjang. Asked if LearnIslam.sg was created to counter websites which may have radical messages, Dr Yaacob said this would narrow the potential of the site.

Apparently, beating Hue Jackson on the field wasn't enough for Baker Mayfield. Mayfield said, per Cleveland.com's Mary Kay Cabot. A day after throwing four touchdown passes in a 35-20 win over Cincinnati and then rejecting a postgame hug from his former coach, Mayfield called Jackson "fake" as the Browns rookie quarterback fended off criticism of his behavior. He was hired earlier this month as an assistant by Cincinnati. Mayfield is showing the athleticism and accuracy that made the Browns gamble on him in the draft instead of going with Sam Darnold, Josh Allen or Josh Rosen.

TOPEKA ( AP ) - A bill that would rescind restrictions on the development of private property near historical sites in Kansas is drawing opposition. The Topeka Capital-Journal reported Monday the Kansas Legislature passed the law in 2014, prohibiting new residential or commercial development within 1,000 feet of National Register of Historic Places sites and within 500 feet of state or national parks. The law is set to expire at the end of 2022, and a bill by state Sen. Ed Berger, R-Minority Leader, would repeal the prohibition of new development near historical parks.

The Toronto real estate market is showing signs of stirring from its deep freeze , with new listings starting to increase while sales numbers remain down, the latest market report from the Toronto Real Estate Board shows. The average price of a resale home was up 5.4 per cent year over year to $786,909, while condo sales were up 10 per cent, while the average price dropped 11 per cent, to $464,729. TREB's president, Phil Soper, said the price declines were driven by the "supply-demand mismatch." The report is based on transactions that closed in March and were recorded in the Toronto MLS.
